title: Head of Affiliates
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Head of Affiliates.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Head of Affiliates do at Domestika?
As the Head of Affiliates, you will be responsible for managing the Affiliate Team and will focus on data and planning actions and campaigns to create significant growth on Affiliates and in markets where we are currently operating as well as future markets.
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Define co-owned goals, objectives, KPIs and creating reporting.
‚Ä¢ Leading the affiliate department and drive quality traffic to the brand.
‚Ä¢ Act as the Product Owner of the affiliate platform.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for the P&L for affiliate revenues.
‚Ä¢ Design and implement a strategy to increase the number of affiliates and improve performance affiliates campaigns.
‚Ä¢ Develop new actions and initiatives with other channels.
‚Ä¢ Oversee and collaborate with the Data Team and Country Managers to design and implement an affiliate strategy for each market.
‚Ä¢ Manage and guide the affiliate team in accordance with the growth objectives for each channel and market.
‚Ä¢ Advising your team on how to acquire new affiliates and maintain current accounts.
‚Ä¢ Hiring new team members.
‚Ä¢ Mentor and coach a team whilst driving a high-performance culture.
‚Ä¢ Analyze competitors benchmark in order to get new recommendations and opportunities.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ At least 3-year experience in a similar role.
‚Ä¢ Experience with engagement, types of traffic, registers, and brand awareness KPIs in different international markets.
‚Ä¢ Experience developing affiliate platforms according to affiliates‚Äô necessities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to negotiate fairly in both affiliates‚Äô and company's interest.
‚Ä¢ Highly proactive, organized, solutions-driven, digitally focused, and a great team player.
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate clearly and passionately when leading the team.
‚Ä¢ Excellent people skills to ensure a high-performing team.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to both work independently and interface with cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English. Other languages are a plus.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ A position in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ Fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Senior Paid Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Domestika is looking for a Senior Paid Marketing Data Analyst.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Senior Paid Marketing Data Analyst do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Daily definition of Budget splits across advertising platforms, accounts and campaigns based on Data.
‚Ä¢ Tracking of daily revenue across markets.
‚Ä¢ Performance analysis of Landing Pages, A/B test, Audiences, Ads, creatives, etc.
‚Ä¢ Track and analyse user lifetime value across advertising platforms and countries and suggest actions based on results.
‚Ä¢ Analysis of audiences used in campaigns.
‚Ä¢ Track, analyse and define the impact of paid action on the total company performance.
‚Ä¢ Analysis of KW research for Google Ads.
‚Ä¢ Analyse of courses performance x country/language for Paid channels.
‚Ä¢ Analyse the Performance by product (Instagram, Youtube, stories, search etc) and market to define the best marketing split for each country.
‚Ä¢ Creation of reports and dashboards.
‚Ä¢ Feed the paid marketing team with insights and actions in order to improve the performance of campaigns.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ At least 5 years experience in data roles, related to marketing.
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of Paid Marketing data analysis as well as Google Analytics.
‚Ä¢ Very strong analytical skills.
‚Ä¢ Very proactive to suggest improvements and definition of next steps.
‚Ä¢ Advanced SQL knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Advanced level of Spanish and English.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Youtube Specialist
description:
Domestika is looking for a Youtube Specialist.
Your main responsibility will be to manage all aspects of the Domestika YouTube channel.
You will be part of the Social Media team and will work closely with different areas of the Marketing department to create communication content.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers in the creative field. From this grew a community of over 5 million people who are curious and passionate about learning new skills.
Today, Domestika produces online courses. We share editorial content for and with the best creative people in the world. We run creative events where teachers, creative professionals, and students all have the chance to share experiences, ideas, and projects.
What does a YouTube Specialist do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Schedules and publishes content as well as community management, optimization, and audience management tasks.
‚Ä¢ Manages the YouTube content calendar.
‚Ä¢ Use data to suggest ideas on formats and topics to enhance channel performance.
‚Ä¢ Stays up to date on YouTube trends globally and in the creative/e-learning sector to create content strategies and promote best practices.
‚Ä¢ Builds and creates a community and an audience and generates web traffic from new users.
‚Ä¢ Analyzes daily channel performance and draws conclusions from the data to improve performance and positioning.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years of experience managing a brand's YouTube channel with a large audience.
‚Ä¢ You are used to working with remote teams.
‚Ä¢ A high level of English is a must.
‚Ä¢ You are independent and proactive.
‚Ä¢ You can explain growth hacking strategies that you have created or collaborated on and understand the results.
‚Ä¢ You have the ability to assimilate the brand personality and understand the creative environment.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with management, analytics, and social media tracking tools (G. Analytics, Monday,...).
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Mobile Application Developer

mobile applications

and design

malfunctions

title: Backend Developer
description:
We are looking to hire an experienced Backend Developer who possesses a passion for mobile and web technologies and will work with next-generation payment gateway platform to help us keep growing in the area of mobile payments, financial technology services. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic, definition, and maintenance of the platform database, and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your coworkers into the platform. A strong understanding of front-end technologies is therefore necessary as well.
The office is located in Barcelona, Rambla Catalunya
Responsibilities for Backend Developer. Our candidate should work on the following areas:
-  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, analyze, design, and ship new platform features
- Develop application programming interfaces (APIs) to support platform functionality
- Suggest and implement new web-based products, applications, and protocols
- Fully responsible for backend application development in the team
- Implement new technologies and architectures to maximize application performance
- Remain up to date with the terminology, concepts, and best practices for coding modern web-based applications
- Work closely with colleagues to constantly innovate application functionality and design
- Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side
logic
- Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure project meets business objectives and compliance standards
- Building and documenting reusable code and libraries for future use
- Optimization of the platform application for maximum speed and scalability
- Implementation of security and data protection
- Design and implementation of data storage solutions
- Write code and tests, build prototypes, solve issues, profile and analyze bottlenecks
- Design high-performance and robust APIs to support mobile and web clients
- Manage and optimize scalable distributed systems on the cloud
- Optimization of web applications for performance and scalability
- Develop automated tests to ensure business needs are met and allow for regression testing
- Communicate with users to understand their needs and experiences
Skills and Qualifications:
- Proficient experience with software development tools and back-end programming languages/technologies/products using Java, JavaScript, Python, Node.js, MEAN stack, MySQL and PL/SQL, NoSQL databases
Strong experience in J2EE, Spring Boot, Angular, React.js, Docker, RabbitMQ, Kubernetes, CQRS, WebSockets
- Experience in MVC/MVVM concept and software design pattern, microservices architecture
- Strong knowledge in RESTful web services
- Expertise in cloud platforms like AWS, GCP
- Deep understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitHub, GitLab, automated unit testing, Gerkin, Jenkins, Selenium, DevOps skills
- Data migration, transformation, and scripting
- Experience with Agile or Scrum software development methodologies
Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work
Background
- Graduate from Information Technology, Computer Science or any related disciplines
- More than 5 years of hands-on proven backend development experience
- Good command of Spanish and English, with proper interpersonal skills - We offer a competitive remuneration package
- Candidate can work remotely

title: Technical Product Manager TV/IPTV/STB/OTT

We are a global company located in sunny Barcelona with additional offices in the UK, France, Italy and Germany. Our team comprises more than 24 nationalities across 180 employees; we are united in our vision of diversity and our passion for cinema.
Rakuten TV ‚Äì ‚ÄúYour cinema at home‚Äù ‚Äì Rakuten TV is one of the leading Video-On-Demand platforms in Europe providing the latest movie releases with the latest technology in a true cinematic experience available on Smart TVs. title: Graphic & Visualization Designer
description:
Passionate about design and analytics?
Want to work in an international, creative, dynamic team?
If your answer is yes, keep reading!
ClearPeaks is a specialist Business Intelligence consulting firm headquartered in Barcelona, with offices in Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Reus, and Croatia. Since the year 2000, we have been delivering top quality data management and business intelligence solutions to customers in many industries such as Telecommunications, Sports, Entertainment, Finance, Retail, Real Estate and Oil & Gas.
We‚Äôre looking for a highly talented and motivated candidate to join us as a Graphic Designer in Barcelona. 
This is a unique opportunity to work in a cutting-edge sector and take charge of the overall branding of the company, while also acting as a creative design consultant in exciting projects that range from classic BI to Big Data and Predictive Analytics.
The Graphic Designer will have 2 main responsibilities:
1. ClearPeaks Marketing Graphic Designer:
‚Ä¢ Responsible for the design and creative input for all internal & external corporate documents
‚Ä¢ Design for newsletters, new website features & other digital documentation & collateral, following the ClearPeaks guidelines
‚Ä¢ Responsible for the design of print material such as brochures and folders
‚Ä¢ Creation of unique & business-relevant imagery for social media, web and other marketing collateral
‚Ä¢ Optimize, from a design perspective, marketing content such as customer success stories, company sales documents, brochures & flyers, website, newsletters, blog articles, press releases
‚Ä¢ Lead the creation of corporate and recruitment video
2. BI Project Graphic Designer:
‚Ä¢ Active involvement in BI/Data visualization Projects as a graphic designer
‚Ä¢ UX design of projects
‚Ä¢ Creation of mock-ups and examples for BI projects (Dashboards, Reports)
‚Ä¢ General creative advisor for our consultants on various BI projects
Requirements
‚Ä¢ Degree of Graphic Designer
‚Ä¢ 1 to 3 years of experience as a Graphic Designer (experience in the IT sector is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud products such as InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop as well as PowerPoint and Word
‚Ä¢ Experience with UX/UI design
‚Ä¢ Experience in corporate video design
‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset ‚Äì experience in infographics and data visualization is a huge plus
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English and Spanish, written and spoken
‚Ä¢ Passionate about corporate design & branding as well as new technologies
‚Ä¢ Excellent written & oral communication skills
‚Ä¢ Experience with video creation, animation and editing is a plus
‚Ä¢ Self-starter
‚Ä¢ Multitasking, flexible person, energetic and hard worker
‚Ä¢ Very organized and detailed, proactive and positive, results-oriented & committed to company growth
‚Ä¢ Proactive, flexible and energetic person committed to company growth
‚Ä¢ Highest quality focus in all activities including context, design, grammatical and visual quality checks is a must
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated understanding and appreciation of graphic design; colour theory, typography and layout.
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail, creativity and problem-solving skills.

title: Digital Marketing Lead
description:
ABOUT JEXO
We‚Äôre a small startup growing extremely fast, building Jira apps. We recently reached 1,000 installations and are about to reach 500 paying customers before our 3rd anniversary. This means we‚Äôre on our way towards becoming a leading project management app factory in the Atlassian cloud ecosystem. But we can‚Äôt get there without your help! 
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
We‚Äôre looking for a Digital Marketing Lead. This is a remote position, and can be based outside the UK with a freelancer formula. The salary range is negotiable, we‚Äôre thinking 35k-40k depending on your skills and experience.
We‚Äôre establishing a refreshing brand that stands out, and we have built a good content factory to position Jexo as an authority in the Jira PM space. 
Our next marketing challenge is to overhaul digital distribution and brand exposure. Finding and building audiences, no matter where they are, will be your mission. This is an essential position in the team as we scale our customer base and build the self-sustained Jexo of tomorrow.
We need your strong skills in digital marketing, social media growth and community engagement to help make Jexo a household name and build robust marketing and sales funnels.
WHAT WE OFFER:
This is a remote role so you can work from wherever you want, and with flexible working hours. There‚Äôs also the option for shared co-working space.
We offer quite a variety of benefits:
    üå¥ Paid days off, sick days and parental leave
    üìö 10% of work time dedicated to skill development
    üìà Virtual shares program
    üí∞ Monthly bounties for remarkable achievements
    üíµ Regular salary adjustments
    üçï "Pizza & Games" - monthly virtual get together
ABOUT YOU
You should be digitally savvy, like really, with a decent skill set and an analytical mind that can benchmark performance and forecast results. You know social media channels inside out, and the tricks to tracking and finding the right data. You feel passionate about emerging media and tech, Google Analytics, and you‚Äôre a pro at research.
Mandatory experience is required in certain areas:
    At least 2 years of experience in digital media marketing
    Good with SEO & SEM, content marketing, and data & analytics
    Good with Google display ads, pay-per-click ads, social media
    Be able to quickly create and track campaigns
    Understand how LinkedIn works
    Understand the basics of video
    Know how to talk to the technical community and b2b communities
    Interest in project management and technology
    Consumer centric and data-driven thinking
    Understand design-based thinking and planning
Also optional but good to have:
    Work with Google Analytics and Semrush
    Understanding of the Portfolio Project Management and Jira landscapes
    Experience working with an agile team

title: Project Manager - Courses Production
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Project Manager - Courses Production.
You will be part of the course production operations team across all the regions that Domestika operates. The Project Manager will collaborate in the development of coordination infrastructure in course traffic within the production department as well as in the monitoring and resolution of interdepartmental problems related to the production of Domestika courses. Your main responsibility will be to coordinate the courses agenda and extract relevant data from operations to generate reports, keep track of objectives and KPIs.
About Domestika:
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 6 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Project Manager for Production do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Extracts and analyses data related to the course production operations.
‚Ä¢ Generates reports relevant to the performance and the needs of the department.
‚Ä¢ Creates detailed projection plans connected to key elements of the workflow between teams, providing the tools for better and more efficient work.
‚Ä¢ Helps manage calendar needs by working closely with our programming team.
‚Ä¢ Supports team members with data connected to their work and performance, creating periodic reports.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ You have 3+ years of experience as a project manager, preferably in start-up companies.
‚Ä¢ You have good knowledge of project management tools (Trello, Monday, Asana, Notion, etc..).
‚Ä¢ You have excellent problem solving skills, organized, and capable of designing, improving, and implementing processes, anticipating the needs of the organization.
‚Ä¢ You have analytical skills and have a data-driven attitude in everything you do. You excel at using spreadsheets.
‚Ä¢ You are able to quickly build trusting relationships across a company.
‚Ä¢ You can communicate fluently in Spanish and English.
‚Ä¢ It is a plus if you have experience in e-learning platforms.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Data Science Architect

title: Post-producer / Colorist (S√£o Paulo)
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Post-producer / Colorist.
Your main responsibility will be to attend to the post-production needs of the courses and trailers that are going to be edited ‚Äîproject preparation, transcoding, synchronization, sending to the cloud, resolution of incidents‚Äî and those already edited; that is, apply the knowledge of image retouching as if it were a digital laboratory to shape tasks, increase decorations, add visual effects, do technical retouching, color grade, identify problems, offer technical-artistic solutions, and export the final content in defined formats.
You will be an important part of DOMESTIKA's post-production department in S√£o Paulo and you will also attend to the needs of teams from Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Peru, Colombia, Spain, the US, and the UK.
Domestika is one of the largest growing communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does the post-producer / colorist do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Have the raw filming materials available for transcoding and schedule tasks on the available machines.
‚Ä¢ Organize the assigned courses and prioritize the execution, according to needs and timeline, of the following tasks: invisible VFX, shaping, color and grading, exports, etc.
‚Ä¢ Manage completed courses and their assembly material to proceed with archiving.
‚Ä¢ Ensure the nomenclature and location of materials in published projects, hard drives, server, backup, etc.
‚Ä¢ Share with your team the technical and artistic advances of color for validations, opinions, and approvals, and also to receive help in case of sensory jam.
‚Ä¢ Detect and record extraordinary technical-artistic processes and their solutions, with screenshots, video captures, or texts, to create a documentary fund that can be used if similar situations arise to be solved.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ You have a native or bilingual level of Portuguese.
‚Ä¢ You have an advanced level of English.
‚Ä¢ You have a minimum of 2 years of experience in post-production roles.
‚Ä¢ You have knowledge of color theory, formats, dimensions and metadata, storage, backups, conforming, grading, and editing with professional knowledge of DaVinci Resolve.
‚Ä¢ You have professional knowledge of the Adobe CC Suite, especially Photoshop and After Effects.
‚Ä¢ You have knowledge of export formats, proxies, color spaces, generation and application of LUTs, data depth, disk storage calculation, nomenclatures, media management, archiving, and project recovery.
‚Ä¢ Proactivity to provide improvements, automation, increase in process speed, and implementation of file access security.
‚Ä¢ You have great attention to detail to make the final digital packaging of the courses, ensuring artistic and technical excellence so that students are satisfied.
It is a plus:
‚Ä¢ Management of the Fusion module and programming.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of workflows in the DaVinci collaborative environment.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of photography, especially in relation to correct exposure, ranges, and log curves, following pre-established lighting schemes.
What do we offer you in exchange?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A fun, creative, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Performance Designer Senior
description:
Who we are?
Stori is one of the fastest growing fintech start-ups that combines data+technology to serve the unbanked population in Latin America. Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society and from day one, we have set a bold goal to serve one hundred million low-income people by 2028.
Our leaders, with over 70 years of financial services and technology experience, have been personally involved in two of the largest financial inclusion success stories in the world: Capital One and Mastercard. Now they are marshaling those experiences, and advanced technology and global resources to serve the Latin America communities. We are supported by some of the most prestigious venture capital funds from Asia and U.S. We launched a digital credit card in Mexico, well positioned to become a big force.
Our mission:
Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society. In the Americas alone, hundreds of millions of consumers are either underserved by, or do not have access to, financial products.
Come make a big difference in financial inclusion; make a difference in people lives. Join Stori!
About us and our culture:
We are a diverse group that is passionate about making a difference in the world while also enjoying the time we spend together as a team. We support each other, we push each other, we reward each other, and we have fun together - even in the home office we find the time to have regular non-work meetings. Collectively, we have developed these core principles that we value as the pillars of our culture:
- Passion for our teammates and the social impact that we‚Äôre making drives personal fulfillment and team success
- Ideas and proposals can come from everyone for everything, no one should ever be stuck in a single vertical
- Everyone has the autonomy to make decisions and the support to execute them
- Collaborative environments are born out of open and constructive communication
We are looking for a Sr. Performance Designer to create and manage advertising designs for all of our acquisition channels.
To be successful, this person must have knowledge of graphic design and motion graphics. You must also demonstrate the experience and ability to develop and implement creative proposals, from script planning to copy verification. This person must also show teamwork skills.
This person must carry out a weekly follow-up/evaluation of all the visuals within different channels, to understand what type of visuals works best and thus properly iterate the campaigns of each channel.
The Senior Performance Designer must carry out all artistic innovation in each project he manages, thinking of new ways to create unique designs that have a significant impact on clients.
As Senior Performance Designer you will:
- Design and deliver all visuals; static and videos, advertising for channels like Google, FB, and others for the acquisition generation
- Make sure all creativity is delivered according to required schedules and deadlines
- Assist with audience research and develop creative briefs to align creative work with our clients' profiles.
- Leadership, management, and responsibility of assigned advertising projects.
Requirements for the position:
- Able to facilitate creative workshops, critiques, and design reviews
- Consistently demonstrates a strong understanding of customer needs and motivations
- Clear and accurate writing and communication skills.
- Embrace and nurture diverse perspectives to inspire product thinking.
- Embrace change and adapt quickly to changing job demands.
- Prioritize tasks so that they are consistent with the organizational vision and goals of the department.
- Photoshop and illustrator management
- Experience in creating graphic content for social networks
- Corporate design experience
- Management of premiere and after effects
- Creation of graphic content for digital campaigns (financial line)
- Results-based design iteration

title: Web Developer
description:
The ideal candidate is a Web Developer with experience and excellent front-end development skills, publishing through CMS and good graphic skills, with the desire to get involved and to interface with our new customer.
Please send your CV in .pdf format or available on the website, including authorization to process personal data.

title: Community Manager Bilingual English/German
description:
Are you open-minded, and believe in the freedom to explore alternative lifestyles without judgement? If you‚Äôve got bags of initiative and can answer yes to the above, then carry on reading.
About us. 
We‚Äôre Playamedia ‚Äì a dynamic bunch of professionals that focus on marketing and community management for a number of our own online dating brands such as Fetisch.de, the kink-positive BDSM community for fetish dating.
What are we looking for? 
We‚Äôre searching for an enthusiastic German-speaking Community Manager to join our team at our beachfront office in Barcelona working on developing and growing our active community on Fetisch.de.
The ideal person for this job will be a professional, passionate about social technologies and customer satisfaction with fantastic communications skills and the drive to build and maintain an authentic community with unique brand values like ours.
Your typical day will include:
Creating regular content to increase community quality, engagement and user retention via news feed posts, newsletters, surveys and other entertaining community actions
Social Media ‚Äì fostering authentic relationships with influencers/followers to spread the brand‚Äôs presence beyond the community on Fb, Twitter, blogs and other channels
Liaising with customer support. Coordinating our volunteering forum & chat moderators on a day-to-day basis. 
Managing a group of freelance content writers.
Communicating and monitoring compliance and brand guidelines inside the community and across other product services such as marketing and support
Gathering, analysing and escalating user feedback in order to draft recommendations for improvements on UI/UX, community management and overall user satisfaction
Writing copy for new product features and FAQs in line with our brand tone and the other languages it‚Äôs available in.
Providing regular performance feedback to management regarding user activity, retention rate and reactivation, measured in KPIs such as Monthly Active Users or Net Promoter Score.
This job might be for you if you have the following‚Ä¶
You are a 
German speaker and have an excellent level of English 
Min. 3 years experience as a Social Media or Community Manager
Proven track record in fostering user engagement (logins, session duration, and other user interactions on digital products incl. webs or apps) and follower engagement (likes, shares, comments)
Proven track record in building followers in the thousands (ideally 10k-100k, preferably on Instagram and Youtube)
Internet savvy with proficiency in using Google Drive, Office Suite, data-sharing dashboards, and more
You are a data-driven, creative, solution-oriented team player and a good listener with an open mind and fantastic mediating skills
Positive attitude with a willingness to learn and grow
What‚Äôs in it for you?
Competitive Salary 
Flexible Hours: 40 hours / week. (Starting no later than 10am).
Time for Training: Daily development hour (1pm ‚Äì 2pm).
Great Food: Healthy lunch at the office with veggie options.
Awesome Location: You‚Äôll love our stunning beachfront office in La Barceloneta
Join us!
Data Privacy Policy
 https://www.playamedia.com/jobspp/

title: Content and Curation Manager (3D & Animation)
description:
Domestika is looking for a Content and Curation Manager - 3D & Animation.
Your main responsibility will be to lead all the processes associated with the didactic approach and content creation of the 3D and Animation channel at Domestika.
Together with other teams, you will coordinate the curriculum, the content of the courses, and the planning of this channel at Domestika. You will be part of the course scheduling team, working closely with the strategy, curation, marketing, and production teams. You will be ultimately responsible for ensuring that the content of the courses is of the highest quality and is adapted to the needs of Domestika students.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
Today, Domestika produces online courses. We share editorial content for and with the best creative people in the world. We run creative events where teachers, creative professionals, and students all have the chance to share experiences, ideas, and projects.
What does a Content and Curation Manager (3D & Animation) do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Build the curricular body of the category according to its characteristics at Domestika.
‚Ä¢ Have a comprehensive vision of the category: from the analysis of the international market to the final content of the courses, through the search and selection of the leading voices in each subject.
‚Ä¢ Define the focus of each course and oversee its content structure, ensuring that it meets the instructional objectives of the course.
‚Ä¢ Ensure that the quantitative and qualitative objectives of the area are met at Domestika.
‚Ä¢ Develop content guidelines for the different types of courses and teachers within the category.
‚Ä¢ Develop reports on the status of the main KPIs in the category.
‚Ä¢ Propose and lead improvement initiatives in the course criteria and selection.
‚Ä¢ Advise the Acquisition and Production teams on the approach and development of content for each course.
‚Ä¢ Be responsible for the excellent quality of the courses in this category, thanks to the active listening of feedback from Domestika students.
‚Ä¢ Be responsible for ensuring that the performance of the courses in this category follows an upward trajectory.
Things that should ring a bell:
‚Ä¢ Selecting and discovering talent.
‚Ä¢ Working together with teams from different countries.
‚Ä¢ Developing curricula and didactic programs.
‚Ä¢ Having outstanding coordination skills.
‚Ä¢ Advising on the creation of educational content.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Previous experience of at least 5 years in the world of 3D and Animation.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the world of audio and performing arts will be valued.
‚Ä¢ Strategic vision. Ability to analyze data and draw conclusions.
‚Ä¢ Consolidated experience in the creation of educational programs and/or content related to the category.
‚Ä¢ Advanced English level.
‚Ä¢ Mastery of other languages will be valued.
‚Ä¢ Professional knowledge of 3D & Animation software and technical tools.
‚Ä¢ It is essential to be up to date on current 3D & Animation trends.
‚Ä¢ Business vision of the digital industry.
‚Ä¢ Ability to identify leading talents in this area around the world.
‚Ä¢ Unquestionable criteria of the world of 3D and Animation.
‚Ä¢ Desirable relevant teaching experience in schools, workshops, or universities.
‚Ä¢ Coordination of people and projects for a minimum of 3 years.
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate at the executive level.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the reference companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A fun, creative, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
KingEclient is looking for a Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team in Madrid.
How would we describe this role and our perfect candidate?
- Lead the design process from the conceptualization to the implementation phases, working together with Product Designers, Researchers, Data Scientists, Product Managers and Engineers.
- Communicate and envision service concepts and ideation work using methods and tools that illustrate all the components and touch points of the service.
- Deliver expert reviews, usability audits and testing, focus groups and workshops, personas, customer journeys, and information architectures.
- Define user flows, low and high-fidelity mockups, detailed interaction specs, and prototypes to communicate interaction and design effectively.
- Present and argue design concepts in front of internal and external stakeholders.
- Contribute to the creation and maintenance of Design Systems, together with other designers.
- Work with the Innovation & Design Strategist and CX Project Manager to engage the most appropriate skill sets on each project.
- Inspire innovative approaches to design, using creative facilitation techniques and taking the lead at stakeholder meetings and team brainstorm sessions
About your knowledge and personal skills:
- Minimum 5 years of experience as a UX/UI Designer, designing native apps, web, and other devices for e-commerce or e-learning products.
- Amazing online portfolio.
- Ability to understand business requirements and user needs and transform them into functional design proposals.
- Hands-on design expert, shaping the concept and seeing it through to detailed Interface design and implementation across a variety of devices and platforms.
- Obsessive attention to detail and good taste in layout, typography and visual hierarchy.
- Understanding of how user research should be integrated into a project and a good understanding of all the other relevant skill sets, including Business Design, IT, Brand and Marketing.
About your knowledge and personal skills:
- Be an expert in the development of responsive designs and navigable prototypes
- Have management skills and communication with the client
- Know how to work with Design Systems
- Be used to work as a team
- Love telling what you know to your peers
- Have a high level of English
- Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Powerpoint, Excel)
- Knowledge of Spanish and English (high level).
About your softskills and values:
- You are passionate about and everything that surrounds it.
- You like to defend your work to clients.
- You consider yourself responsible.
- Proactivity defines you.
- You accept constructive criticism and you use it to improve.
- You are willing to give a helping hand to those in need.
- You consider yourself a respectful and tolerant person.
- You fix yourself clear goals and do anything to achieve them
- You are a positive and happy person
We also value:
- Other languages.
- That you use Sketch and Abstract to develop the conceptualization and finalize the design process.
- MBA, postgraduate in Marketing or some other area applicable to the CX world
What we offer:
- Full time job (remote)
- Personal and professional growth
- Young and cool work environment
- Flexibility and remote work (hybrid model after covid restrictions)
- Nivel de antig√ºedad
- Intermedio

title: Senior Front-End Developer
description:
Do you want to change the world through digital design by working on socially impactful and meaningful projects? 
Would you like to work on award-winning projects for International Organizations around relevant topics such as Gender Equality, Childbirth, or LGBTIQ+ rights?
If your answer is yes, then this is the opportunity you've been waiting for! 
---
OUR OPPORTUNITY:
At Elkanodata we are looking for an experienced, award-winning Senior Front-End Developer to develop interactive projects and impactful interactive experiences. You‚Äôll work on both award-winning projects and day to day client needs, hands-on or overseeing other front-end developers.
As the new Senior Front-End Developer, you‚Äôll work alongside other in-house Front-End developers, Designers and Project Management teams to lead our agency to higher heights and deeper depths.
You‚Äôll work closely with designers and creatives to develop top-quality interactive experiences, products and tools whilst coordinating with Project Managers to deliver projects on time and according to client‚Äôs expectations, standards and timings.
In addition to this, you‚Äôll work on multiple projects simultaneously from initial briefing through to successful completion, you‚Äôll do this independently hands-on or collaborating with other in-house developers and freelancers.
Occasionally, you‚Äôll communicate and coordinate with external technical teams: clients and vendors and oversee the quality and technical standards of freelance developers, participate in QA processes and implement necessary changes to validate coding best practices and standards: code review, cross-browser compatibility and functionalities, etc. You'd also work through continuous integration and continuous deployment (Travis and BitBucket pipelines).
---
YOUR EXPERIENCE:
We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you have:
- 5+ years‚Äô experience as a Senior Front-End Developer in a digital or web development agency environment, who has won high quality and award-winning interactive projects.
- 2+ years‚Äô experience managing a team of developers.
- Proven experience and portfolio managing top quality digital and interactive projects (please, share your portfolio of developed projects).
- Knowledge of Project Execution Methodologies (waterfall and agile) being able to propose process improvements and Project Management tools and tracking systems (Asana, Basecamp, Trello, Jira, etc.)
- Proven ability to juggle projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detail.
- Multicultural background and excellent communication skills in English.
As the Senior Front-End Developer, you will have experience using the following technologies:
- Proficient in JavaScript, HTML5 and CSS3 (SASS)
- Have experience with task runners, in preference Webpack
- Have experience with JavaScript Frameworks, in preference Vue.js/Nuxt.js
- Have experience with Git source control
- Have experience with Sketch
- Knowledge with optimizing performance and browser compatibility
- Pixel perfect development
- Have experience with D3.js
- Have experience with Greensock libraries
- Have experience with Node.js
- Have experience with ES6, Babel, Webpack
---
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
As the Senior Front-End Developer at Elkanodata you will:
- Work hands-on in both award-winning projects and day to day agency work.
- Collaborate with Designers, Project Managers and other developers to make sure that projects are delivered with the highest quality standards in a timely manner.
- Manage a team of 2 in-house developers and coordinate with external partners.
- Work alongside Business Development and Project Managers to estimate technical opportunities and provide time estimations.
- Solve problems through Code review, quality assurance, debugging and troubleshooting.
- Liaise with external technical teams, on the client side, third-party vendors, partners and freelance collaborators to oversee the quality and technical standards of projects.
---
BONUS POINTS:
- Have basic knowledge of databases such as MySQL, MongoDB
- Knowledge with WordPress and/or Drupal
- Have experience with ReactJS
- UX/UI or design background / skills.
- A keen interest in the design, data visualization, motion graphics, and digital sectors
- An interest in social causes and purpose-driven organizations.
---
ABOUT US:
At Elkanodata, we transform complex information and data, into insightful, innovative and attractive digital experiences for relevant topics and stories that matter.
Our clients are International purpose-driven Organizations and thought leaders that are based in the United States and Europe, including, among others, The World Economic Forum, The World Bank, The European Union and the United Nations; specifically based in New York, Washington D.C and Geneva.
We identify as an Information Design Agency that‚Äôs able to support our client groups across the digital spectrum ‚Äì Landing pages, websites, product launches and motion graphics to raise awareness and drive social change through top quality, award-winning digital experiences.
We have an amazing and talented international team that consists of digital designers, Art Directors, Front End Developers and Digital Project Managers to lead us to excellence.
---
WHY JOIN ELKANODATA?
Besides our clear and defined purpose, mission and values to change the world through digital design, Elkanodata‚Äôs core focus is to build, develop and create a motivating, inspirational and inclusive employee experience for you.
 Although the position can be fully remote, our office is based in the heart of Barcelona, close to some of the best restaurants (vegan/Veggie-friendly), bars, clubs and gyms Barcelona has to offer. You're a stone throw away from some of the major sites, and can easily access public transportation if need be. We've created a hub for creatives, with a multicultural team, you'll have the opportunity to knowledge share, create bonding working relationships, and be around people that share the same passion for design as you do - We're up and coming, you'll have the chance to make your mark on a growing international agency that's core focus is to work on social and relevant causes throughout the world.
To confirm, on this occasion, as the team is working remotely due to the pandemic situation, we can consider candidates in and around Spain or in a similar time zone 
‚ÄúElkanodata is an equal opportunity employer. It is the policy of Elkanodata to give equal opportunities in employment and career development regardless of sex, sexual orientation, sexual identity, marital status, race, age, political view, disability, gender reassignment, pregnancy, maternity and paternity, religion or ethnic origin, whether you refer to yourself as a UX or UI designer, if you like Rum Rasin ice cream, and or if you are an Android or iPhone/Apple user etc."

title: Digital Project Manager
description:
Do you want to change the world through digital design by working on socially impactful and meaningful projects?
If your answer is yes, then this is the opportunity you've been waiting for!
OUR OPPORTUNITY:
----------
We‚Äôre in search of an experienced, award-winning PROJECT MANAGER to develop interactive projects and impactful interactive experiences‚Ä¶ you‚Äôll work on both award-winning projects and day to day client needs. As our new PROJECT MANAGER, you‚Äôll work alongside our other in-house Developers, Designers, and Project Managers to lead our agency to higher heights and deeper depths.
You‚Äôll work closely with designers/creatives to develop top-quality interactive products and tools, whilst coordinating with Project Managers to deliver projects on time and according to the client's expectations, standards, and timings. In addition to this, you‚Äôll work on multiple projects simultaneously from initial briefing through to successful completion, you‚Äôll do this independently whilst at times collaborating with other members of the team.
YOUR EXPERIENCE:
----------
We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you have exposure and experience as a PROJECT MANAGER in an agency environment, who has won high-quality and award-winning interactive projects. You‚Äôd also ideally have knowledge of Project Execution Methodologies (waterfall and agile) and be able to propose process improvements. Along with the above, you‚Äôll have knowledge of Project Management Softwares (Trello, Basecamp, Jira, etc.) and be fluent in the English language, both speaking, reading and writing.
As DIGITAL PROJECT MANAGER, you will:
+ Translate our client needs and briefs into a detailed and comprehensive project plan with a clear execution phase and tasks
+ Coordinate internal resources and freelance resource for the flawless execution of projects
+ Build a strong relationship with the technical and creative teams, and external vendors, being able to motivate under pressure, tight deadlines, or peak production delivering high-end products
+ Schedule and resource projects in the creative proposal phase or project kick-off
+ Streamline the creative team in project execution timings, juggling between various simultaneous projects and optimizing resource allocation
+ Ensure that all deliverables are error-free, on time, and in line with client-facing quality expectations
+ Translate client feedback into specific and detailed technical and creative instructions for the team.
+ Elaborate project wrap-up reports bringing insights and areas for improvement.
+ Have ongoing communication with the client for ongoing projects, delivering on time, budget, and according to the quality expectations.
BONUS POINTS:
----------
+ Experience in Data Visualization projects
+ Experience working in a smaller agency, freelance or self-started project
+ Experience with time-tracking software and implementation
+ Experience with Resource Allocation software
+ A technical background or similar
+ A keen interest in the design, data visualization, motion graphics, and digital sectors
ABOUT US:
----------
At Elkanodata, we transform complex information and data, into insightful, innovative, and attractive user experiences.
Our clients are international organizations and thought leaders that are based in the United States and Europe, including, The World Economic Forum, The World Bank, The European Union, and the United Nations; specifically based in New York, Washington D.C, and Geneva.
We identify as a Creative Design Agency that‚Äôs able to support our client groups across the digital spectrum ‚Äì Landing pages, websites, product launches, and motion graphics.
We have an amazing and talented workforce that consists of digital designers, Art Directors, Front End Developers, and Digital Project Managers to lead us to excellence.
OUR PURPOSE is to be the leader in information design within inter-governmental organizations (IGO) by 2022, offering the highest quality work to our clients from our multicultural and diverse team located in Barcelona.

title: Director of Trust & Safety
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Director of Trust & Safety.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
We are looking for an outstanding Director of Trust & Safety to help us grow Domestika into the leading global brand for online creative education. At Domestika, we have a fast-growing community of students and teachers, and we want to ensure the well-being and safety of our members. As a Director of Trust & Safety, you will take a leading role in achieving that.
What does a Director of Trust & Safety do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Owns the areas of content moderation, privacy protection, fraud detection and crisis management and mitigation at Domestika.
‚Ä¢ Leads the Trust & Safety team. Hires, mentors and trains members and introduces them to Industry best practices in all of the team‚Äôs disciplines.
‚Ä¢ Serves as a domain expert. You closely follow the industry‚Äôs policies and best practices in the Trust & Safety field, and implement them in Domestika.
‚Ä¢ Handles crisis escalation and management and works in tandem with the C-suite, the Legal and Communications, in designing a response that ensures the safety of Domestika‚Äôs users, employees and its brand.
‚Ä¢ Guides the Product department in building Trust & Safety tools to optimize team efficiency and performance.
‚Ä¢ Promotes the creation and definition of community and user policies, including content publishing rules, community behavior guidelines, and terms of use, and enforces them.
‚Ä¢ Partners with the Customer Support department in handling user requests which are connected to Trust & Safety, and ensures consistent communication on our policy.
‚Ä¢ Collaborates with our Director of Payments in handling monetary fraud, and in developing tools and techniques to identify and eliminate malicious actors.
‚Ä¢ Works with data on analyzing malicious user behaviors, assesses their risk and defines countermeasures to combat them.
‚Ä¢ Manages the well-being and safety of the Trust & Safety team.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Proven leadership track record in building and leading Trust & Safety. You have experience in all five fields of content moderation, policy creation, privacy protection, fraud prevention and crisis. 
management. You have led a Trust & Safety team for 3+ years, and have demonstrated the ability to execute at the top level.
‚Ä¢ You have collaborated and directed a product team on managing a backlog for internal Trust & Safety tools.
‚Ä¢ Strategic and analytical. You employ a data-driven product approach, and have the ability to make your team highly efficient.
‚Ä¢ Organized. You promote structure and process in your team. You have the ability of handling large sets of data, and making them accessible to your teams. You make everyone around you perform better.
‚Ä¢ Decisive. You own the decision-making process, and the results coming off it. You know how to delegate. You structure the decision-making process for your team members, and empower them to build their decision-making skills.
‚Ä¢ Team player. You roll up your sleeves when required and join the team when your hands-on experience is needed. You always put the team first priority.
‚Ä¢ Great communicator. You have the ability of taking complex concepts and making them accessible to your counterparts. You are concise, and keep things clear and simple. You are fluent in English; Spanish is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Mentor. You support your T&S team, and help them to be successful. You are empathic and have experience leading team members of all levels of seniority.
‚Ä¢ Mentally tough and mature. You are capable of handling sensitive situations and materials, and maintain your composure and performance at all times. You are mature, and capable of sharing your mental state with others in the effort of protecting you and the team.
‚Ä¢ Scrappy and Frugal. You believe a team can achieve a lot, even when limited in resources.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility to work remotely at all times.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ Innovative and startup environment with zero politics and a ‚Äúwin as a team‚Äù spirit.

title: Beca Content Creator - Pr√°cticas
description:
What we are?
Making Science is a leading digital marketing and technology consulting firm, that is listed in the Madrid Stock Exchange. We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, Par√≠s, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. We are a company that specializes in providing comprehensive marketing and technological solutions for digital businesses. Our team is composed of more than 360 digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data. 
Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person‚Äôs contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?
Some details about your department
At Brand and Content, we focus mainly on building a brand's identity and discourse. We look for profiles that are sharp, and that have the capability to think critically and adapt quickly to projects that have different approaches: from the creation of a brand's identity to the development of an omnichannel storytelling through content.
In this department, analytical capabilities are as important as creativity. Our projects always start by analyzing the audience, the market, and the competition to gain a deep understanding of the media and digital channels. Our proposals stand out strategically, and rely on measurable data.
Our objective is to always offer our clients effectiveness in their messages, and work with them to build a credible brand in a competitive environment.  
Your role
Writing of current contents of different sectors with the aim of generating traffic.
Writing SEO optimized content.
Identification of interesting topics for the clients. 
CMS management for uploading content to the client's website.
At the end of the 6-month internship, you should be able to understand the needs and objectives of the client's business, propose growth strategies and implement them.
What will you need to do this role?
You must be proactive, eager to learn and the ability to generate results in a few weeks, be able to adapt yourself to new challenges and have a positive attitude.
You are interested in generating content for different sectors and brands.
Valuable a Master's Degree or a Course in Digital Marketing with basic knowledge of optimized content writing.
Possibility of an agreement with a school/study center.
Perks of joining us
A full-time, 6 month paid internship under an agreement with your university or school.
You will never stop learning with us. You‚Äôll receive constant training and development, with a focus on innovation.
We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours and an intensive work schedule during July and August. 
Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don‚Äôt have a dress code. 
We know how to have a good time! Monthly TGIF events, 5V, and much more!
Never go hungry with our free daily fruit and our vending machine card!
Take a break on our terrace, play foosball, darts or PlayStation
Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you‚Äôll grow fond of!
If you have initiative, great ideas and a knack for connecting with people...
We want to meet you!

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
Gamelearn is the world-leading company in skills training through video games and a pioneer in the development of game-based learning solutions. Gamelearn has revolutionized corporate training by developing the most awarded game-based learning platform in the world. With over 15 years of experience, we have trained more than 200,000 professionals from more than 5,000 companies across 5 continents (Coca-cola company, Apple, HP, Boeing, Pfizer, BCD travel, World Bank, IQVIA, etc.)
Our team is passionate about video games and personal development. We believe in having fun at work in a relaxed environment (our offices have foosball and ping pong tables, video game consoles, sofas, vending machines, etc.)
As Product Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for developing product marketing strategies and campaigns that effectively communicate the Gamelearn‚Äôs value proposition to specific buyer personas across all content mediums (newsletters, videos, website, events, sales collateral, etc.)
Join a young, multicultural, creative, and innovative team with an incredible purpose: to help adult learners reach their full potential. Ready to make learning fun again?
Functions
* Build on product messaging that sets new products and functionalities apart from others in the market to give them a unique selling point
* Communicate the vision and value of new products to the sales team and develop sales tools that facilitate the selling process
* Plan and participate in the launch of new services and products which involve several different departments
* Brief the press and PR teams about new products and features added to the Gamelearn platform
* Take part in presentations to communicate our products‚Äô value proposition successfully and in a way that engages the audience
* Obtain insights into client‚Äôs usage of current products, untapped opportunities and buyer personas, through interviews, surveys, focus groups and sales data
* Agree timelines and deadlines for the development of new products and features with product management and engineering departments
* Use market research data to establish product pricing competitively

Requisitos m√≠nimos:

* An undergraduate degree in either Marketing or business-related disciplines
* Experience in product marketing within SaaS companies
Additional skills...
* Collaborative skills: You collaborate with multiple teams across the business. This will often include the sales and marketing department, the engineering department, product management, press and PR and senior executives.
* Communication skills: The ability to speak and write to a high standard is crucial. You will frequently have to present new products and write engaging copy, telling the ‚Äòstory‚Äô of products, for various marketing channels.
* Research skills: Gain insight into customer needs and experiences. Analysis of data, surveys and customer interviews will be part of this mix and you need to be well acquainted with these techniques.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Domestika is looking for an Infrastructure Engineer - Remote - Time Zone GMT and GMT +2.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. 
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does an Infrastructure Engineer do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Build, test and maintain the infrastructure that supports the Domestika public platform.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the development team to add new functionalities and improve deployment processes.
‚Ä¢ Build and operate the systems used to monitor the platform's health and performance.
‚Ä¢ Look for performance improvements in the Domestika web platform.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Demonstrable experience of AWS (EC2, EKS, S3, VPC, ALB, RDS, ElasticCache) and GCP.
‚Ä¢ Experience in building and operating the infrastructure for high traffic Web Applications based on a 3-tier Architecture (Frontend, Backend, Database).
‚Ä¢ Experience in building complex CI/CD pipelines with multiple testing environments (Stagings, Pre Production, Production).
‚Ä¢ Experience working with automated tests such as Unit, Acceptance, Smoke, Regression, End 2 End, and Functional tests.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with Docker and Docker orchestrators (Kubernetes).
‚Ä¢ Experience working in Highly Available, Scalable and Resilient environments.
‚Ä¢ Experience in identifying/resolving application performance issues and SPoF.
‚Ä¢ Experience in executing stress tests.
‚Ä¢ Experience in troubleshooting complex problems.
‚Ä¢ Focus on efficiency, simplicity, and maintainability.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work as a team in an agile, pragmatic, and quality-oriented environment.
Would be a plus:
‚Ä¢ Experience in designing and implementing Fault Tolerant solutions.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with applications that store data in Non-Relational databases like Elasticsearch and Redis.
‚Ä¢ Experience caching Dynamic Application data (HTML cache, application object cache, database query cache, etc).
‚Ä¢ Experience with Gitlab CI and Gitlab Review Apps.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ An active work environment where you can hone your skills, learn alongside your colleagues, and develop your career.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Desarrollador Aplicaciones  iOS
description:
En Corporalabs desarrollamos soluciones digitales para el sector de la moda y el retail. Contamos con m√°s de siete a√±os de experiencia trabajando con marcas del retail como Pepe Jeans, Bimba y Lola, Hackett , Ecaolf o Injusa.
Nuestra aproximaci√≥n es desarrollar proyectos personalizados asegurando la calidad y una buena experiencia de usuario. Trabajamos en un entorno din√°mico, creamos relaciones estables y a largo plazo con nuestros clientes.  
Definimos y desarrollamos aplicaciones de ecommerce de cliente final (B2C) como en el entorno empresarial (B2B). Nuestros clientes est√°n en Madrid, Barcelona, Vigo, Alicante y Londres.
Nuestra oficina est√° en C/Mar√≠a de Molina 39 de Madrid, con mucha luz y un bonito √°tico, aunque realmente tele trabajamos toda la semana menos los martes., que nos juntamos y comemos todos juntos. Tenemos un horario flexible desde la 8:00 AM, los viernes nos desconectamos a las 15:00 y disfrutamos de  23 + 2 d√≠as de vacaciones.
Proponemos un contrato indefinido, aunque que no se descarta ning√∫n otro tipo de colaboraci√≥n.
El perfil:
Buscamos un desarrollador con experiencia profesional en iOS de al menos 3 a√±os, desarrollando aplicaciones de forma limpia y eficiente, priorizando la calidad, escalabilidad y mantenibilidad.
El candidato nos gustar√≠a que tuviera experiencia en diferentes arquitecturas MVVM, MVP, VIPER, etc.  Es importante que conozca ampliamente Core Data, el uso de librer√≠as con Cocoapods, Autolayout, conectividad  con APIs de tipo RESTful y parseado y manipulaci√≥n de documentos JSON y XML. Se valora experiencia con Swagger.

Las principales tareas son el an√°lisis de requisitos y dise√±o de nuevas aplicaciones m√≥viles nativas par iOS, desarrollo y mejoras continuas. Dichas aplicaciones se integrar√°n con plataformas de terceros como SAP, SalesForce o Magento, por lo que valoramos la experiencia en este tipo de integraciones.

We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, Par√≠s, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. title: Software Developer
description:
Who we are?
Stori is one of the fastest growing fintech start-ups that combines data+technology to serve the unbanked population in Latin America. Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society and from day one, we have set a bold goal to serve one hundred million low-income people by 2028.
Our leaders, with over 70 years of financial services and technology experience, have been personally involved in two of the largest financial inclusion success stories in the world: Capital One and Mastercard. Now they are marshaling those experiences, and advanced technology and global resources to serve the Latin America communities. We are supported by some of the most prestigious venture capital funds from Asia and U.S. We launched a digital credit card in Mexico, well positioned to become a big force.
 Our mission:
Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society. In the Americas alone, hundreds of millions of consumers are either underserved by, or do not have access to, financial products. Come make a big difference in financial inclusion; make a difference in people lives. Join Stori!

About us and our culture:
We are a diverse group that is passionate about making a difference in the world while also enjoying the time we spend together as a team. We support each other, we push each other, we reward each other, and we have fun together. Collectively, we have developed these core principles that we value as the pillars of our culture:
Passion for our teammates and the social impact that we‚Äôre making drives personal fulfillment and team success
Ideas and proposals can come from everyone for everything, no one should ever be stuck in a single vertical
Everyone has the autonomy to make decisions and the support to execute them
Collaborative environments are born out of open and constructive communication
 
Who are we looking for?
 - Have 3 or more years of experience in software development with Python. Experience with AWS is preferred but not required
- Be competent in backend development like APIs or batch processing. And have experience or be eager to develop tools for internal users with Django, Flask or a Javascript stack
- Write high quality, well-tested code to meet the needs of internal and external customers.
- Be familiar with product and design lifecycles, and collaborating closely with designers, engineers, and product managers.
- Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a STEM field
 
 Benefits
- WFH during the contingency
- Competitive salary and fast growth
- Open Culture, inclusive and dynamic environment
- Law benefits & extras
- 10 days for vacations
- Yoga classes, functional trainings

‚Ä¢	Good eye for color, lighting and composition skills.
Nice to have
‚Ä¢	Creativity and passion about games and gaming industry.
‚Ä¢	Unity Experience
‚Ä¢	PBR asset creation and the PBR Lighting workflow experience
‚Ä¢	Experience with stylized environments and props
‚Ä¢	Proficiency in both high and low-poly modeling, sculpting, and re-topology
‚Ä¢	Rigging best practices knowledge
‚Ä¢	Comfort working within technical constraints, optimization, and implementation

title: Creative Design Manager
description:
Who we are?
Stori is one of the fastest growing fintech start-ups that combines data+technology to serve the unbanked population in Latin America. Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society and from day one, we have set a bold goal to serve one hundred million low-income people by 2028.
Our leaders, with over 70 years of financial services and technology experience, have been personally involved in two of the largest financial inclusion success stories in the world: Capital One and Mastercard. Now they are marshaling those experiences, and advanced technology and global resources to serve the Latin America communities. We are supported by some of the most prestigious venture capital funds from Asia and US We launched a digital credit card in Mexico, well positioned to become a big force.
Our mission:
Financial inclusion has been a persistent challenge in our society. In the Americas alone, hundreds of millions of consumers are either underserved by, or do not have access to, financial products.
Come make a big difference in financial inclusion; make a difference in people lives. Join Stori!
About us and our culture:
We are a diverse group that is passionate about making a difference in the world while also enjoying the time we spend together as a team. We support each other, we push each other, we reward each other, and we have fun together. Collectively, we have developed these core principles that we value as the pillars of our culture:
Passion for our teammates and the social impact that we‚Äôre making drives personal fulfillment and team success
Ideas and proposals can come from everyone for everything, no one should ever be stuck in a single vertical
Everyone has the autonomy to make decisions and the support to execute them
Collaborative environments are born out of open and constructive communication
What will you do?
Conceive, design and deliver product logos, marketing materials and internal support resources
Conceive, design and deliver all graphics, materials and advertising assets for seasonal sales promotions.
Conceive, design and deliver all advertising and lead generation creatives for all marketing platforms.
Make sure all creativity is delivered according to required schedules and deadlines
Manage the output of images on our website, ads on FB and FB and all social media channels to deliver a consistent and clear creative message
Write, distribute and update our style and branding guides, making sure they are clearly understood and followed by all team members.
Act as a guardian of the brand ensuring that all brand guidelines are met, collaborating with other departments (including our external web team) so that our creative output is consistent and has the highest quality standards.
Keep procedural documents up-to-date for all key creative and design processes, in collaboration with the finance and administration manager
Assist the company management in formulating its overall creative direction and design strategy.
Assist with audience research and develop creative briefs to align creative work with our clients' profiles.
Manage all image sources and control quality. Direct any filming or internal photography project
Build a team of freelancers and vendors to support the company's growth projections.
Leadership, management and responsibility of the team members put at your disposal to help you in your role.
Requirements for the position:
- Over 4.5 years of experience as a graphic designer / creative manager for an online business with cross-platform touchpoints.
- Willingness to work after hours at times to help us deliver our projects.
- Strong communication skills, with impeccable written and spoken English
- Comfortable and experienced working remotely and independently
- Video editing and animation experience
- Handles After Effects maybe you know 3d programs like C4D or Maya
- Have experience and take photos and videos in a practical way (Premiere, FinalCut, After Effects)
- MUST: Work on creating visuals for Brand and for Performance (generation of visuals for ads)
Benefits
WFH during the contingency
Competitive salary and fast growth
Open Culture, inclusive and dynamic environment
Law benefits & extras

title: ERP Consultant Bilingual German
description:
We are hiring for an ERP/CRM Consultant (German native speaker) to our company. We support your professional and personal development on a weekly basis, allowing you to grow with us. Since 2018 we work in sunny Malaga, having flexible working hours in a bright, open office in the city center.
Our team supports the customers of Open Solutions located in Hamburg, this company was founded in 2007. Through the services of Alliantum (ERP) and Space Frog (eCommerce), we offer flexible solutions, which meet the interdependence of both areas in know-how and implementation.     
Alliantum is focused on the digitalization of business processes with the enterprise resource planning system Odoo (formerly OpenERP). As an official Odoo partner with 10 years of experience, we provide consulting and services around ERP systems. In times of permanent changes, we support future oriented companies regardless of their location.
Space Frog is a Start up which brings a breath of fresh air into the world of eCommerce. Apart from classic services such as web development and graphic design, we focus on all those services that provide competitive advantages in nowadays digital world: data analysis, search engine management, eCommerce platforms and product placement.
If you are an ERP/CRM Consultant and very curious by nature, then we have matching tasks for you. You will manage and follow all the ERP/CRM projects of our company. Your everyday life will be exciting, varied and full of new technologies to learn so that we offer you the opportunity to take into Odoo and working as an Odoo Consultant. Also, are you missing speak in German sometimes? You will have a lot of communication in German with our clients.
Wondering about your tasks?
- Analyse and optimize existing ERP processes
- Project management: coordinate the implementation and start-up projects of the assigned clients
- Communication with our clients
- Testing
- Functional design
- Training
- Resolution of functional incidents
- Learn Odoo in the first month of your new career
What we expect from you?
- Experience in ERP/CRM
- Experience managing projects
- Profile with autonomy and initiative
- Attitude to learn permanently, formally and informally
- Good communication skills
- German skills is a must
- High level of English is a plus
- Advanced Spanish skills
- Experienced in working with Mac is a plus
Are you ready to being part of the team?
