title: Frontend Developer
description:
As a Frontend Developer in the GAMMA UI team, you will be responsible for constructing rich Web Applications which feature elements of Data Visualization and designing optimal interfaces to AI solutions that solve complex problems.
Creating reusable components using React which can be composed to form the next generation User Interfaces will be key to scale our capabilities at BCG GAMMA.
Your creative abilities will be critical in cases to transmit clarity to users when interfacing the work performed on the Back End of applications by our Data Scientists and AI Software Engineers.
YOU'RE GOOD AT :
Expressing empathy with end-users in order to design clear, effective UI solutions to complex problems.
Visualizing information and data which may not naturally fit onto a Cartesian Grid.
Writing reusable, functional JavaScript, and working alongside team members using Agile methodologies.
Working within time constraints whilst still going beyond the brief to bring delight to end-users!
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS) :
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Data Visualisation.
A Github/Codepen/Blog demonstrating your passion for Front End topics.
1-2+ years of experience in a Software Engineering role using JavaScript.
1+ years of experience with ReactJS
Experience using Azure/AWS/GCP microservices to interface backend functionality.
Creative experience with CSS, SVG, and ideally GSAP animation library.
Excellent proficiency in English.

title: VP Online Marketing
description:
At Domestika we are hiring a VP Online Marketing.
As VP Online Marketing, you will be responsible for the full-funnel acquisition & retention program internationally. This includes responsibility for paid & organic channels, the operation & optimization of the eCommerce experience, CRM & lifecycle marketing, pricing & revenue analysis and go-to-market strategy for new product & market launches.
Domestika is one of the largest growing communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills. Domestika has the support of one of the most relevant funds in Silicon Valley.
The team is distributed across 10 countries. This role will begin remote and the final location is flexible based upon the candidate.
What does a VP Online Marketing do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Being in charge of all the digital marketing channels, the candidate should be able to achieve the marketing goals together with the team.
‚Ä¢ Partner with our creative, PR and content teams to scale the levers that drive meaningful business impact (acquisition, referral and customer LTV).
‚Ä¢ Build financial forecasts based on different budget scenarios and partner with finance to develop the P&L.
‚Ä¢ Lead full-funnel acquisition, retention and lifecycle marketing across paid social, paid search, SEO, affiliates and email (marketing and transactional) globally.
‚Ä¢ Manage the on-site eCommerce experience including promotional campaigns, merchandising and delivery.
‚Ä¢ Expand channel strategy & optimize the media mix based on insights from experiments (geo, channel, stage of marketing funnel).
‚Ä¢ Own the Marketing & Advertising Technology roadmap and partner with Product to prioritize the needs of the Marketing team.
‚Ä¢ Lead the pricing & revenue analysis disciplines evolving our dynamic pricing model by market.
‚Ä¢ Partner with the Data team to manage marketing analytics and insights tools to drive performance across the full funnel.
‚Ä¢ Lead with vision, clarity, and collaboration to empower teams -both marketing and cross-functionally- to do their best work and drive performance.
‚Ä¢ Build a global performance marketing organization that achieves key metrics by creating strategy, setting goals, engaging with cross-functional partners, managing planning and communication, and overseeing timely execution and analytics.
‚Ä¢ Recruit a world-class team of performance marketers to help you execute your vision.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 7+ years experience leading performance marketing/growth teams ideally for a media or eCommerce organization with 15+ years experience in a performance marketing function.
‚Ä¢ Multiple years in a high-growth, global B2C company. Bonus if you led a global expansion team or the launch of new international markets.
‚Ä¢ The ability to manage the deep technical and financial details and timings of the role while also developing high-level strategic frameworks and managing cross-cultural teams.
‚Ä¢ Proven expertise in SEO/SEM, paid social, affiliates, social media organic, mailing and other direct response channels.
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity building full-funnel KPIs including experience with MTA model development.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in audience development, mid-funnel lead nurturing and CRM.
‚Ä¢ Ability to motivate the team, understand the needs and communicate the top management strategies to move in the same direction.
‚Ä¢ Experience with OOH/OTT/TV, direct mail, podcasts/radio, SMS, push notifications, referrals and partnerships is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to engage with financial teams, product/engineering organizations and creative & executive leadership.
‚Ä¢ Native or near-native English speaker. Fluency in Spanish a plus.
‚Ä¢ An entrepreneurial, owner‚Äôs mentality.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the fastest-growing companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ Great compensation package with a meaningful equity stake.
‚Ä¢ Flexible, remote work environment with the opportunity for global travel (when safe again!)
‚Ä¢ Medical & Vision Insurance.
‚Ä¢ The opportunity to be a key leader in a high-growth company.

title: Project Manager of Operations
description:
Domestika is looking for a Project Manager of Operations, to support the workflow in the Programming department as well as work with data and performance analysis.
Your main responsibility will be to extract and analyze relevant data to the operations within the Programming department, find new ways to streamline processes and build better workflows between teams.
We need someone with a strong analytical capacity, data-driven and with great ease to work with numbers. To be organized is key since you will be working directly and indirectly with a team of more than 30 people. Having previous experience with a rapidly growing environment and an innate ability to adapt is also important.
You will be part of the Global Programming team, working closely with the Acquisitions, Content & Production teams. We are a diverse group, located in Europe and America, with a creative background and a fast-paced environment.
About Domestika:
Domestika is the world's fastest-growing online creative community focused on education. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, helping them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. From this grew a community of over 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Project Manager of Operations do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Extracts and analyses data related to the department‚Äôs operations.
‚Ä¢ Generates reports relevant to the performance of the team and the needs of the company.
‚Ä¢ Creates detailed projection plans connected to key elements of the workflow between teams, providing the tools for better and more efficient work.
‚Ä¢ Helps manage calendar needs by working closely with our content production team.
‚Ä¢ Supports team members with data connected to their work and performance, creating periodic reports.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in project management, preferably in start-up companies.
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of project management tools (Trello, Monday, Asana, JIRA..) and capability to prioritize.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with CRM tools.
‚Ä¢ Self-starter and creative thinker capable of finding new ways to improve our operational workflow.
‚Ä¢ Experience in e-learning platforms is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time distribution skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Fluency in Spanish and English.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the creative industry-leading companies.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Post-producer / Colorist (Madrid)
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Post-producer / Colorist.
Your main responsibility will be to attend to the post-production needs of the courses and trailers that are going to be edited ‚Äîproject preparation, transcoding, synchronization, sending to the cloud, resolution of incidents‚Äî and those already edited; that is, apply the knowledge of image retouching as if it were a digital laboratory to shape tasks, increase decorations, add visual effects, do technical retouching, color grade, identify problems, offer technical-artistic solutions, and export the final content in defined formats.
You will be an important part of DOMESTIKA's post-production department in Madrid and you will also attend to the needs of teams from Latam and Europe.
Domestika is one of the largest growing communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does the post-producer / colorist do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Have the raw filming materials available for transcoding and schedule tasks on the available machines.
‚Ä¢ Organize the assigned courses and prioritize the execution, according to needs and timeline, of the following tasks: invisible VFX, shaping, color and grading, exports, etc.
‚Ä¢ Manage completed courses and their assembly material to proceed with archiving.
‚Ä¢ Ensure the nomenclature and location of materials in published projects, hard drives, server, backup, etc.
‚Ä¢ Share with your team the technical and artistic advances of color for validations, opinions, and approvals, and also to receive help in case of sensory jam.
‚Ä¢ Detect and record extraordinary technical-artistic processes and their solutions, with screenshots, video captures, or texts, to create a documentary fund that can be used if similar situations arise to be solved.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ You have an advanced level of English.
‚Ä¢ You have a minimum of 2 years of experience in post-production roles.
‚Ä¢ You have knowledge of color theory, formats, dimensions and metadata, storage, backups, conforming, grading, and editing with professional knowledge of DaVinci Resolve.
‚Ä¢ You have professional knowledge of the Adobe CC Suite, especially Photoshop and After Effects.
‚Ä¢ You have knowledge of export formats, proxies, color spaces, generation and application of LUTs, data depth, disk storage calculation, nomenclatures, media management, archiving, and project recovery.
‚Ä¢ Proactivity to provide improvements, automation, increase in process speed, and implementation of file access security.
‚Ä¢ You have great attention to detail to make the final digital packaging of the courses, ensuring artistic and technical excellence so that students are satisfied.
It is a plus:
‚Ä¢ Management of the Fusion module and programming.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of workflows in the DaVinci collaborative environment.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of photography, especially in relation to correct exposure, ranges, and log curves, following pre-established lighting schemes.
What do we offer you in exchange?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A fun, creative, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Android Developer (Kotlin)
description:
At Domestika, we‚Äôre looking for an Android Developer (Kotlin) to join our mobile team - Remote - Time Zone GMT and GMT +2.
 We‚Äôre looking for experienced professionals with talent and the desire to discover new ways to create experiences through an app. We love the blend of an elegant and precise solution from good coding with an eye for beauty to build a solid interface through attention to detail.
As an Android Developer, you will work on enhancing the Domestika app by implementing new features and building awesome interfaces. You‚Äôll work closely with your technical manager, the product manager, fellow designers, and other developers to build the best possible mobile experience.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does an Android Developer do at Domestika?

‚Ä¢ Offers a world-class experience to our users by building a solid, sleek, and above all fun app.
‚Ä¢ Tests app features and fixes issues.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Experience using Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ At least 3-5 years of experience using Java.
‚Ä¢ Experience interacting with API REST.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of software engineering best practices within the development life cycle, including the principles of clean code, code review, repository and workflow management, continuous integration, compilation processes, testing, etc.
‚Ä¢ The ability to write complex interfaces, view hierarchies, navigation transitions, and pay attention to the small details when building interfaces.

‚Ä¢ Initiative to stay up to date on new Android trends.
‚Ä¢ Active participation in open-source projects or in developing your own apps.
‚Ä¢ Have one of your apps published in the Play Store.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and oral communication skills.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A balanced work-life with a Remote First approach.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ An salary according to your experience and profile.

title: iOS Engineer (Swift)
description:

title: Editorial Content Director
description:
Domestika is looking for an Editorial Content Director
We are looking for a highly experienced Editorial Content Director to manage our in-house creative content production team (designers, copywriters, filmmakers, etc.) to help them produce high-quality content specially designed for social media and SEO that engages with the audience, promotes the online courses, and enhances awareness of the brand.
You will be leading the development of creative assets based on a global brand strategy, measuring performance and effectively ensuring world-class creative. This is an essential role responsible for managing Domestika‚Äôs internal creative resources and developing best-in-class production processes to support scaling our branded content and editorial content studio globally.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
Today, Domestika produces online courses. We share editorial content for and with the best creative people in the world. We run creative events where teachers, creative professionals, and students all have the chance to share experiences, ideas, and projects.
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Own the overall development of our editorial content production.
‚Ä¢ Manage Domestika‚Äôs internal creative resources and develop best-in-class production processes to support scaling our editorial content studio globally.
‚Ä¢ Hire new team members.
‚Ä¢ Monitor content performance in order to identify insights to improve future project deliveries and continual execution.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams (social media managers, SEO specialists, data analysts) to plan, facilitate, and develop content analytics projects.
‚Ä¢ Be responsible for brand consistency across editorial content activity.
‚Ä¢ Mentor and coach a team whilst driving a high-performance culture.
‚Ä¢ Run and communicate project timelines, deliverable types, resourcing, and budgeting needs.
‚Ä¢ Effectively manage operative and large-scale projects from the brief through delivery.
‚Ä¢ Facilitate and manage alignment between project needs and other external departments.
Requirements
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience in a project manager, studio manager, or operations manager role with a creative studio, agency, or in-house studio for the digital field and social media.
‚Ä¢ Experience in branded content and editorial content and video production for different markets.
‚Ä¢ Experience prioritizing, managing, and tracking a high volume of creative projects simultaneously with the ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
‚Ä¢ Experience with engagement, traffic, registers, and brand awareness KPIs.
‚Ä¢ Experience with branded content and SEO content.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience working in cross-cultural and international environments across time zones.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work with project management tools, resource planning, and digital asset management with experience building processes and systems for scale.
‚Ä¢ Strong operational skills and ability to thrive in ambiguity at times.
‚Ä¢ Passion for branded content creation and data.
‚Ä¢ Ability to understand the brand value, tone, and language.
‚Ä¢ Editorial mindset with an ability to predict audience preferences.
‚Ä¢ Highly proactive, organized, solutions-driven, digitally focused, and a great team player.
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate clearly and passionately when leading the team.
‚Ä¢ Excellent people skills to ensure a high-performing team.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to both work independently and interface with cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English.
It‚Äôs a plus:
‚Ä¢ Other languages (Spanish, Portuguese, French, Italian, or German).
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn alongside your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ An honest salary based on your experience and profile.
Some of the content that we produce:

title: Report & Data Visualization Designer
Senior Creative Designer
description:
TEAM INTRODUCTION:
AliExpress (www.aliexpress.com) is a global marketplace targeting consumers from around the world and enabling them to buy directly from manufacturers and distributors in China and around the world. It has more than 100 million users and it has been granted the "Editor's choice" award in Google play.
AliExpress Design team is the bridge between the International New Retail business and the customers, providing end-to-end user experience design solutions with a brand identity for both sellers and buyers to meet business/product goals. We work very closely with Alibaba's global partner companies, having constant collaboration with cross-functional teams, such as product managers, marketing, and tech team to ensure simple, creative, and useful products that customers will engage and enjoy.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
- In partnership with Marketing Managers and PMs, conceive innovative, multi-platform ad campaigns for AliExpress (European) marketing and products.
- Capable of influencing product direction and team decisions with innovative ideas and solutions.
- Grow team knowledge of best-in-practice design trends occurring throughout the app, web, and graphic design communities.
- Sensitive to the way a brand unfolds across design mediums, including online and retail marketing communication and digital media.
REQUIREMENTS:
- Has a deep understanding of local design trends, digital media, and cultural nuances for the European Apps and e-Commerce market.
- 3+ years work experience.
- Team player with refined and assertive leadership skills.
- Ability to positively influence change through inspirational design, solid rationale, supporting data, and diplomacy.
- Bachelor's degree in design or equivalent professional experience.
- English fluency required. Additional fluency in French, Chinese is a plus.
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
- We are looking for an online portfolio that clearly demonstrates past work history.

title: Product Design Lead
description:
Do you want to work within an international and multidisciplinary team in an interactive and challenging project, where what you do day after day has a global impact?
This opportunity is for you!
Even if you're not thinking about changes, you never know when your next chance to take that professional leap is going to come up.
We are guided by the feeling that everything is about making an impact in the workplace by millions of people around the world. We are inspired by agile methodologies, and at the end of the day, we believe that the product is the most important thing, but if you are passionate about processes and tools, we also want to hear it!
We are looking for a Product Design Lead motivated to contribute with your knowledge and eager to continue learning and growing professionally.
 RESPONSIBILITIES: 
‚Ä¢	Contribute to high-level strategy by crafting the UX roadmap aligned to the business goals.
‚Ä¢	Drive design strategy for multiple initiatives from large iterative feature projects to experiments and 
        optimizations.
‚Ä¢	Partner with product management, marketing, engineering, and other stakeholders to ensure 
        prioritizing and delivering impactful experiences.
‚Ä¢	Select, plan and drive customer discovery activities to uncover our users‚Äô problems through 
        moderated interviews, usability studies, and other techniques.
‚Ä¢	Lead the design team on design processes to create compelling user flows and ensure high-quality 
        consistent design outcomes.
‚Ä¢	Help shape and evolve the company‚Äôs design culture.
‚Ä¢	Coach, mentor and grow a team of talented designers to refine their individual skills.
SKILLS: 
‚Ä¢	Proven track record running 5+ person product design teams with specialized responsibilities.
‚Ä¢	Experience with B2C software or, at minimum, operationally complicated software (i.e not just 
        single-purpose apps),
‚Ä¢	Experience with the tools used by modern design teams: Jira/Trello, Slack, Confluence, Figma, 
        Invision, Sketch, Zeplin, etc.
‚Ä¢	Natural leadership abilities including great communication skills (written, verbal, and via 
        presentation) along with the ability to give/receive critical feedback.
‚Ä¢	Be comfortable using data and user research to support design decisions.
‚Ä¢	Work well in a fast-moving, iterative environment.
‚Ä¢	Love leading, coaching, mentoring, and growing your team. It is imperative you are comfortable 
        putting in place the structures and processes for a healthy and high-functioning design team.

title: PHP Developer
description:
As√≠ somos:
The Cocktail es una consultora digital cuya misi√≥n es orquestar y acelerar el crecimiento de nuestros clientes. Lo conseguimos porque hay una cosa que sabemos hacer muy bien: movilizar organizaciones para impulsar la relaci√≥n entre las marcas y clientes mediante el dise√±o de productos y servicios, los datos y la tecnolog√≠a digital. Entendemos lo que nuestros clientes necesitan y construimos capacidades a ritmo de mercado y a una velocidad de v√©rtigo.
Nuestro entorno de trabajo se caracteriza por el crecimiento profesional exponencial, y la participaci√≥n en proyectos con impacto real en grandes clientes. El ecosistema de especialistas es amplio y diverso (estrategia, dise√±o, tecnolog√≠a, data, investigaci√≥n‚Ä¶) y la interacci√≥n entre los equipos es nuestro d√≠a a d√≠a.
Formar parte de The Cocktail implica rodearse de personas referentes e inspiradoras de quien aprender, y que te ayudar√°n a crecer frente a los retos que te encontrar√°s. Trabajamos bajo la m√°xima de que es mejor pedir perd√≥n que permiso y en un entorno en el que se aprende del error. Por eso, esperamos de quienes forman la compa√±√≠a que aporten una visi√≥n disruptiva y challenger, sean inconformistas buscando la excelencia y se apropien de los desaf√≠os..
Si quieres moverte en un equipo retador, empujar proyectos innovadores y en definitiva, hacer que las cosas pasen, The Cocktail es para ti.
Este es el reto:
Buscamos a una persona apasionada de PHP que disfrute desarrollando soluciones retadoras y que aspire a trabajar con una visi√≥n end-to-end del proyecto. Todo ello en un entorno multidisciplinar, liderando el proceso de transformaci√≥n digital de nuestros clientes junto con el resto de √°reas de The Cocktail.
Entre otras cosas, esto es lo que har√°s:
En tu d√≠a a d√≠a:
Desarrollar√°s productos utilizando PHP. Adem√°s, utilizar√°s algunos frameworks de este lenguaje, nuestro favorito es Symfony.
En algunos proyectos nos apoyamos en soluciones CMS como Sulu, eZ o Drupal.
Desarrollar√°s proyectos eCommerce usando soluciones como Sylius o Magento.
En caso necesario, echar√°s una mano en temas de Html, Css y Javascript.
Participar√°s en toda la vida del proyecto, desde el prototipado y an√°lisis funcional, hasta el an√°lisis y liderazgo t√©cnico.
Definir√°s la mejor soluci√≥n t√©cnica junto al resto de equipos de Tecnolog√≠a.
Trabajar√°s de forma conjunta con los equipos de UX, Dise√±o Estrat√©gico, Negocio y Estrategia.
Adem√°s, cuando lleves un tiempo aqu√≠ esperamos que seas capaz de:
Asegurar los planes y los procesos de calidad de un proyecto, desarrollando tests y llevando a cabo procesos de CI/CD.
Aprender otras tecnolog√≠as y herramientas como Varnish, Redis, ElasticSearch, etc.
Trabajar con una filosof√≠a 100% DevOps  con herramientas como Jenkins, Docker y Kubernetes. 
Trabajar en infraestructuras Cloud de los principales proveedores: Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform y Microsoft Azure Cloud.
Expondr√°s y argumentar√°s  las fortalezas y aplicabilidad de las soluciones frente al resto de √°reas y al cliente.
Construir un entorno de reconocimiento y celebraci√≥n. Apropiarte de la visi√≥n de la compa√±√≠a y que la hagas propia.
 
La experiencia en The Cocktail:
Modelo de trabajo basado en la autorresponsabilidad y la autogesti√≥n con horario flexible y teletrabajo (de verdad). 
Formaci√≥n pensada para tu desarrollo profesional e individual. 
Acceso a una red de gimnasios por un precio especial.
27 merecidos d√≠as de vacaciones al a√±o y, por si no son suficientes, puedes disfrutar de hasta 5 d√≠as m√°s de extra time. 
Seguro m√©dico privado con cobertura completa.
Posibilidad de retribuci√≥n flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte o cheque guarder√≠a).
Un equipo de trabajo a tu medida para que uses el sistema operativo que m√°s te guste.
No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar. 
Nuestras oficinas est√°n ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad, tanto en Madrid como en Oviedo. 
Ser parte de una compa√±√≠a con alma: no solo por ser dog friendly (tenemos a Maggie en la oficina) si no porque adem√°s, tenemos iniciativas de apoyo a la maternidad (una sala de lactancia en la oficina y programas para mam√°s y pap√°s), la sostenibilidad (pol√≠ticas zero waste), la igualdad de g√©nero y diversidad (iniciativas de visibilizaci√≥n e inclusi√≥n del colectivo LGTB+, colaboraciones para disminuir la desigualdad social...).
En The Cocktail pretendemos ser un referente en talento y calidad humana, y s√≥lo lo conseguiremos siendo una compa√±√≠a abierta y diversa, por eso tenemos un C√≥digo de Conducta que refleja nuestras expectativas de las personas que participan en la empresa. Ofrecemos un entorno acogedor para todos, independientemente de su identidad o expresi√≥n de g√©nero, orientaci√≥n sexual, capacidad, origen, religi√≥n, estatus socioecon√≥mico‚Ä¶
Pr√≥ximos pasos:
Si has llegado hasta aqu√≠ es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atenci√≥n ;)
Ap√∫ntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echar√° un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibir√°s una llamada para conocernos mejor, que podamos contarte m√°s sobre The Cocktail y el sobre el rol.
Nuestros procesos de selecci√≥n suelen tener alrededor de dos o tres entrevistas, y es posible que en alg√∫n momento queramos verte en acci√≥n y te propongamos un reto t√©cnico. Al final del proceso charlaremos acerca de las condiciones salariales del puesto, una vez te conozcamos bien y sepamos cu√°nto puedes aportar.
Si necesitas un tip para el proceso: simplemente queremos que seas t√∫.

title: Junior Talent Sourcer
description:
At Domestika we‚Äôre looking for a Junior Talent Sourcer.
As a Junior Talent Sourcer, you will contribute to identifying and securing best talent, with an eye toward increasing the applicant quality in close partnership with the Talent Acquisition team. In addition, you will be responsible to coordinate interviews between our hiring manager(s) and candidates. You will be part of the Human Resources team and will report directly to the Talent Acquisition Lead.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Junior Talent Sourcer do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Partnership with Talent Acquisition Specialists to generate ideas, leverage existing resources (ATS, LinkedIn Recruiter, social media, databases and any other open sources) and share information that facilitates an effective sourcing and candidate attraction strategy.        
‚Ä¢ Generate talent pool for Domestika business needs by using existing and creating new ones through extensive market research and various social sourcing methods.
‚Ä¢ Conduct thorough market research to navigate key companies and build an accurate pipeline of prospective candidates.
‚Ä¢ Approach suitable candidates for screening purposes and qualify against agreed competencies and criteria for each project.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate meetings/interviews between candidates and hiring managers.
‚Ä¢ Maintain data quality and accuracy on the company‚Äôs internal database.
Things we value in a Talent Sourcer:
‚Ä¢ Organized, persistent and flexible. Attracting the best is always difficult, we trust that you will not give up!
‚Ä¢ Being a good person, caring for people and very good at maintaining relationships, not only with candidates but also with all the Hiring Managers throughout our offices. Excellent communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Believe in the Domestika project.
‚Ä¢ Enjoy meeting new people.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Previous experience as a sourcer or coordinator is a plus, especially in startups or digital companies. 
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English, both spoken and written. Another language is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Good nose for talent.
‚Ä¢ Taste for art and creative environments.
‚Ä¢ Very good level of communication, adaptation to any interlocutor, and speaking naturally with people all over the world. 
‚Ä¢ Curious about new tools to find the perfect candidates.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ Fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ An honest salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Portfolio Project Manager
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Portfolio Project Manager.
As the Courses Portfolio Project Manager, you will be responsible for coordinating and supervising actions in all markets to promote the catalog of existing courses at Domestika. You will be part of the Marketing Planning team and will work with the Digital Marketing Channels, Growth, Data, Content and Production teams, among others.
Domestika is the global largest growing community within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those people who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. From this grew a community of over 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Courses Portfolio Project Manager do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Controls the catalog of existing courses on Domestika website and proposes actions to empower them.
‚Ä¢ Manages and supervises campaigns that help attract potential students.
‚Ä¢ Detects opportunities and trends by targets & markets with which to attract the course catalog.
‚Ä¢ Ensures the health of the courses portfolio and seeks opportunities to enhance their sale capability.
‚Ä¢ Investigates new ways to innovate the course portfolio‚Äôs promotion based on possible growth opportunities or needs detected.
‚Ä¢ Supervises and addresses courses that need to be updated or improved.
‚Ä¢ Ensures excellence in the representation of existing courses.
‚Ä¢ Works with the Pricing team to assure best pricing for the courses catalog.
‚Ä¢ Works with the Analyst specialist to monitor KPIs of the portfolio and also make sure that the actions activated are successful.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 4+years of experience managing catalogs, preferably in e-commerce companies.
‚Ä¢ Experience in e-learning platforms is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Self-starter and creative thinker capable of finding new ways to promote Domestika‚Äôs catalog.
‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of project management tools (Trello, Monday, Asana, JIRA..) and capability to prioritize.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time distribution skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Fluency in Spanish and English.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Work in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A fun, creative, collaborative and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A dynamic environment where you can develop, learn from colleagues and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Senior App Product Designer
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Senior App Product Designer - Remote - Time Zone GMT and GMT +2.
Domestika is the fastest-growing creative community. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
We‚Äôre looking for a UX/UI Designer to help us improve Domestika‚Äôs user experience as part of our core Product team. The Senior App Product Designer will be a key player in the end-to-end process of enhancing Domestika and provide the best learning experience for our users.
As a senior team member, you‚Äôll take the lead of UX/UI design, defining best practices and building exceptional experiences for Domestika‚Äôs huge community of users. You‚Äôll work within a squad, side by side with Product Managers, Engineers, and Data Scientists.
What does a Senior App Product Designer do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Lead the design process from the conceptualization to the implementation phases of the apps, working together with other Product Designers, Researchers, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Engineers.
‚Ä¢ Identify users‚Äô needs and help them reach their goals with your UX solutions.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the creation and maintaining of the Design System together with other Product Designers and Design System Manager.
‚Ä¢ Conduct user research or competitor analysis to solve user problems or business goals of your squad.
‚Ä¢ Constantly collaborate with other designers to continually raise the bar for the product design quality and exchange expertise.
‚Ä¢ Define user flows, low and high-fidelity mockups, detailed interaction specs, and prototypes to communicate interaction and design effectively.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of experience as a Product Designer.
‚Ä¢ A strong portfolio is a must.
‚Ä¢ Experience designing native apps for e-commerce and e-learning products.
‚Ä¢ Experience designing websites will also be valued.
‚Ä¢ Expertise with design tools and other prototyping tools.
‚Ä¢ Experience working in agile, delivering high-quality work consistently.
‚Ä¢ Experience leading product design projects.
‚Ä¢ Strong visual skills (use of typography, color, grid systems, etc).
‚Ä¢ Strong communication skills.
Would be a plus:
‚Ä¢ Motion graphics knowledge (Principle, After Effects).
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ An salary according to your experience and profile.

title: UX/UI Product Designer
description:
About us
RavenPack is the leading big data analytics provider for financial services. Financial professionals rely on RavenPack for its speed and accuracy in analyzing large amounts of unstructured content. RavenPack‚Äôs products allow clients to enhance returns, reduce risk and increase efficiency by systematically incorporating the effects of public information in their models or workflows. Our clients include the most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers in the world!

We are looking for a full-time UX/UI Product Designer to join RavenPack‚Äôs Product Development team in Marbella (Spain). You will be in charge of the interface and user experience on the next generation of visualization products for our data suite. You will be reporting directly to the Product Manager and will interact with different teams across the organization. 
The ability to communicate effectively in English, both in writing and verbally is a must. Knowledge of Spanish is not a business requirement.
European Union‚Äôs legal working status is required.
Requirements
- +2 years of experience working in Digital Graphic Design, Web Design or related field
- +2 years of professional experience working in digital products for web and mobile platforms and a deep understanding of them
- +2 years of experience working in design tools such as Illustrator, Photoshop, Sketch, Figma, and InVision
- High level of experience in HTML, CSS, and JS are assumed
- Proven success bringing at least one high-quality digital product to market
- Ability to work on tight deadlines while maintaining quality standards
- Ability to create clear wireframes and clean interface designs
Desirable
-+1 of professional experience in React or equivalent knowledge
-+1 year of professional experience working with Jinja2, Mako or Django templates or equivalent knowledge
- Experience designing a product for the Finance industry
Responsibilities 
As a UX/UI Product Designer, you will apply the best practices for improving the customer‚Äôs experience when working with the RavenPack platform. You will work across the entire product process: Information Architecture, User Experience, User Interface, and Interaction Design.
- Developing a deep understanding of RavenPack's product lines
- Understanding our client‚Äôs workflows and building designs that help improve the user journey
- Designing crisp and clean interfaces to maximize user engagement and deliver the best experience
What's in it for you
- Flexibility on when to take a vacation, but remember you will be living in a dream place 365 days!
- Team of Superstars! We are proud to gather an international and diverse team of talented professionals (ex-Silicon Valley executives, Lispers and more)
- Motivational leadership: Here your job title doesn‚Äôt matter, we all sit together and work for the same goal. Grow together, you might even have the CEO sitting next to you!
- Competitive compensation, ongoing training and growth opportunities.
- International and dynamic environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Mobile Apps Engineer
description:
ABOUT GOXO
We help restaurants grow their business online. Food delivery & takeaway is a big and growing market (but current platform-only model (Uber Eats, Deliveroo, etc) is not sustainable for restaurants. We offer restaurants a full solution to create and grow their direct channel in a fast, cost-effective way while keeping control of their own brand and their customers.
We are experiencing very high growth and have ambitious goals and funding to accelerate our international expansion (currently present in the Spanish market). Our goal is to become the most restaurant-centric company in the world. If you love food and developing great technology, we would love to meet you. 

YOUR OPPORTUNITY
We are looking for a Mobile App Engineer to help us take our products to the next level, creating solid, scalable, cost-effective and amazing restaurant experiences using on-the-go apps.
The Goxo stack uses mainly the following technologies: React Native, React JS, Express, Node.JS y MongoDB. We have a set of products aiming at making the restaurant business digitization seamless.

YOUR JOB
Architect and develop Goxo handheld device products to make them reliable and maintainable.
Ensure mobile apps developments and releases‚Äô quality assurance.
Re-scaffold and refactor, sometimes throw away and start from scratch, previously developed features.
Maintain the Goxo apps codebase clean.
Provide support to the operations team by resolving technical issues and build utilities together with the devops team to help them tackle the daily operations.
Help other team developers grow in software craftsmanship.

YOUR IDEAL PROFILE
You will be joining the GOXO team as a Mobile Apps Engineer (Front-zen Ninja), so fasten your seatbelt because we want you to be sound on the following technologies:
React Native together with Redux, Sagas, Recompose, Reselect.
Knowledge of Component-driven Design Principles.	
Knowledge of RESTful APIs / Swagger (Open API) 
Interested in TDD development and quality assurance
Experience to integrate with API Clients for Facebook, Instagram, Apple, Stripe and other third-party services.
Passion for well-crafted and reliable code.
Entrepreneurial, independent, love working on new ideas.
Plus: Knowledge of React.JS, TypeScript
Plus: Knowledge of CD/CI for Mobile such as Fastlane, bitrise or equivalent
Love for food.

YOUR LIFE AT GOXO

You will be joining a great group of people with the common goal to change the restaurant business with technology and data. We‚Äôve been resident at Google for Startups Campus in Madrid as members of Tetuan Valley community, and we‚Äôre now entering a new growth phase and building a larger team to succeed as the spanish market leader in ordering platforms for restaurants.
We will offer you an attractive salary package according to your experience and fit to the role. We also give you an opportunity to write history with us and become part of a fast growing company who is changing the restaurant business.

title: Portfolio Analyst
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Portfolio Analyst.
As Portfolio Analyst, you will be responsible for analysing and interpreting Domestika's portfolio results and actions in all markets. You will be part of the Marketing Planning team and will work with the Data, Content, Production teams, among others.
Domestika is the global largest growing community within the creative industry. It all started as an online forum and a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those people who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. From this grew a community of over 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Portfolio Analyst do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Develops and delivers performance reports with valuable angles, actionable insights and recommendations to support our team members.
‚Ä¢ Alongside the Data team, investigates, reviews and interprets all available sources for portfolio information.
‚Ä¢ Monitors portfolio performance in order to minimize potential risk.
‚Ä¢ Collaborating with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Data Engineers, Data Analyst) to plan, facilitate, and develop Portfolio Analytics projects.
‚Ä¢ Work with the Portfolio team to enable and maintain automated operational portfolio reports for launches executed.
‚Ä¢ Define and monitor clear and actionable KPI‚Äôs.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 4+years of experience in a similar position, preferably in e-commerce companies.
‚Ä¢ The ability to establish, track, and report progress against appropriate metrics that clearly illustrate the impact of our portfolio on business goals.
‚Ä¢ Solid experience in analyzing data and communicating derived insights.
‚Ä¢ Quickly adaptation in a changing environment with problem-solving and decision-making skills.
‚Ä¢ Strong operational skills and able to thrive in ambiguity at times.
‚Ä¢ Self-starter and creative thinker, that is capable of finding new ways of presenting data and simplifying complex processes/topics.
‚Ä¢ A growth mindset & perseverance.
‚Ä¢ Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize workload efficiently.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to both work independently and interface with cross-functional teams.
‚Ä¢ Programming language experience is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ Fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: CRM Tech Specialist
description:
At Domestika, we‚Äôre looking for a CRM Tech Specialist to join our CRM Tech & Lifecycle team.
As a CRM Tech Specialist, your main responsibility will be to be the technical specialist for the tools we use and the platform owner and collaborate with the Lifecycle team and the Operations team to help them achieve perfectly executed email and app marketing campaigns. A successful candidate will be a highly motivated and organized self-starter with strong collaboration and communication skills. You‚Äôll form part of the CRM team and closely collaborate with the Product/IT teams, the Data team, and third party stakeholders, amongst others.
Domestika is one of the largest growing communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for anyone who wanted to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers.
The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills. The company is based in San Francisco, California and the team is distributed in nine countries. Domestika has the support of one of the most relevant funds in Silicon Valley (USA).
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Monitor and maintain the platform and its usage.
‚Ä¢ Understand how our data is integrated with the CRM tool and be able to assist in the development of new integrations and dynamic content based on the data.
‚Ä¢ Assist in creating and executing triggered and blast email and app marketing campaigns using highly personalized data and new template designs.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Product/IT team and our Success Manager to make the most out of the platform we use, Iterable, by enabling use cases not yet possible to implement.
‚Ä¢ Set best practices on how to use the platform within the CRM team, especially for the Lifecycle team and the Operations team.
‚Ä¢ Monitor and troubleshoot deliverability issues to maintain a high reputation score.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 3 years of CRM/email development experience.
‚Ä¢ Experience implementing an ESP.
‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset.
‚Ä¢ Experience with CRM and email marketing platforms (Iterable, Salesforce, Hubspot, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Experience programming dynamic content on CRM platforms (knowledge of Handlebars, AMP, or similar).
‚Ä¢ Experience in working with product/IT teams in order to achieve objectives.
‚Ä¢ Able to work autonomously, effectively prioritize, and deliver to a high standard.
‚Ä¢ Fluent in English. Spanish or Portuguese is a plus.
‚Ä¢ HTML, SQL, JSON, and API knowledge is highly valued.
What do we offer in return?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.
‚Ä¢ A salary according to your experience and profile.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Senior Data Engineer - Remote - Time Zone GMT and GMT +2.
Domestika is one of the largest growing communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our growing team of data experts. The person will form part of the team responsible for expanding and optimizing our data and data platform. The ideal candidate is an experienced data pipeline builder and data wrangler who enjoys designing and optimizing data systems as well as building them from the ground up.
The Senior Data Engineer will support our software developers, database architects, data analysts on data initiatives and will ensure data delivery is consistent throughout ongoing projects. The person should be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products as well as mentoring other members of the team.
What does a Senior Data Engineer do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Assist in the architectural design and implementation of our growing data platform.
‚Ä¢ Implement and monitor best in class security measures in our data warehouse and analytics environment.
‚Ä¢ Identify, design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
‚Ä¢ Design, implement and maintain robust data pipelines to support our reporting needs. 
‚Ä¢ Work with Product, Data and Marketing teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
‚Ä¢ Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
‚Ä¢ Mentor less experienced team members on their day-to-day responsibilities. 
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Minimum 6+ years of experience in a Data Engineer/DataOps role.
‚Ä¢ Experience working on AWS with technologies such as S3, Redshift, Spectrum, Athena, DataLake Formation, Glue, EMR, etc.
‚Ä¢ Working experience with Spark with Python or Scala as well as workflow management tools like Airflow, Luigi, etc.
‚Ä¢ Advanced working SQL knowledge and query optimization.
‚Ä¢ Strong analytic skills and experience working with unstructured datasets.
‚Ä¢ Experience in building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
‚Ä¢ A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from disconnected datasets.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing and data stores.
‚Ä¢ A professional level of written and spoken English is a must.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.

title: Lead Product Data Analyst
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Lead Product Data Analyst.
We are looking for an experienced Lead Product Data Analyst to help us shape our growing Product Analytics team. You would be part of a brand new adventure at Domestika. This role will put you in a position to bring a positive impact from day 1. We are looking for a candidate that is experienced in a user experience centric product focused. In addition to the conversion of the sale experience, we are strong believers that our Learning Experience at Domestika is key for our success.
You will work directly with all Product Managers, our Directors of Product, and will report to our Director of Data.
We are building a dedicated team that will allow us to support and guide all our Product teams. This team will work hand in hand with stakeholders to create a direct impact on insights that influence the way we build our e-learning platform. We want to embrace everything Data has to offer, finding insights, optimizing our processes and even rethinking them.
As our Lead Product Data Analyst, you will build and lead a team of Data Analysts that matches our needs and product strategy. You will mentor the analysts and create the environment to set the team for success. You will play a key role in our organization with an expectation of proactivity.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Lead Product Data Analyst do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Drive for actionable insight gathering, and evangelize a data-driven product culture.
‚Ä¢ Partner with Domestika‚Äôs product leadership in building its product strategy and roadmap.
‚Ä¢ Work with our product teams in all stages of the product life cycle, from ideation to performance analysis.
‚Ä¢ Mentor the product analytics team members and set them up for success.
‚Ä¢ Hire and nurture our Product Data Analysis team.
‚Ä¢ Support the teams in designing A/B tests and analyzing their results.
‚Ä¢ Oversee, review and optimize our decisional analytical framework.
‚Ä¢ Identify opportunities for data enhancement.
‚Ä¢ Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of stakeholders, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
‚Ä¢ Actively contribute to our User tracking framework definition and implementation.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate with other Lead Data Analysts to create synergies between teams.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 6+ years of experience as a Data Analyst in a B2C company, preferably consumer apps.
‚Ä¢ 3+ years leading a Product focused team of Data Analysts covering a wide range of product topics.
‚Ä¢ Analytical mindset.
‚Ä¢ Ability to read and write complex SQL.
‚Ä¢ Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to effectively manage projects supporting multiple business partners.
‚Ä¢ Preferably, a Math/Comp SCI degree or equivalent.
‚Ä¢ Based within European time zone.
‚Ä¢ English required at Full professional proficiency.
Would be a plus:
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with business intelligence platforms - Periscope, Amplitude, Google Analytics, etc.
‚Ä¢ Experience in designing events and tagging for analytics.
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently, take the initiative and have a high level of ownership.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ Balanced work life with a Remote First approach.
‚Ä¢ A fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.

title: Technical SEO Manager
description:
At Domestika we‚Äôre looking for a Technical SEO Manager.
As a Technical SEO Manager within the Marketing area, you will be responsible for optimizing all technical SEO aspects of Domestika, in order to improve the organic presence in search engines. You will create and execute a technical SEO roadmap, to drive traffic and user acquisition at a very large scale. You will work closely with the product, engineering and content SEO teams.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other. 
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Technical SEO Manager do at Domestika?
‚Ä¢ Build, own and execute against the SEO strategy a technical roadmap to capitalize on both short and long term growth opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Perform technical site audits to prioritize solutions for SEO growth.
‚Ä¢ Define measurable goals and technical SEO KPI‚Äôs. 
‚Ä¢ Partner with the product, marketing, and SEO content teams across the company to establish standards to report SEO efforts.
‚Ä¢ Test staging environments before going live.
‚Ä¢ Prevent any kind of technical SEO penalties, and being able to quickly detect and solve Google‚Äôs manual actions.
‚Ä¢ Define a crawling strategy with cloud tools, understand the results and prioritize tasks. Optimize the crawl budget of Domestika.
‚Ä¢ Implement a process to identify new SEO growth opportunities by analysing key technical containers, such as architecture, WPO, audits, backlinking profile.
‚Ä¢ Be an SEO project lead, ensuring optimization requirements are met for all new product launches, data projects, feed optimizations, site enhancements and testing.
‚Ä¢ Analyze and interpret data from server log files, and make decisions to improve web crawling.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated performance on how to scale a technical SEO multilingual e-commerce site is necessary for this role.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ 6+ years of professional experience in SEO (preferably in-house) with a proven track record of successfully developing and implementing SEO programs that significantly improved organic search results.
‚Ä¢ Previous experience leading technical SEO initiatives for a B2C website at scale (millions of pages) is highly preferred.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with sites that have multiple locales and languages.
‚Ä¢ Experience working with SEO and analytics suites or tools: Google Search Console, Google Analytics, BI platforms, SEM Rush, Sistrix, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, DeepCrawl, Log analysers platforms, etc.
‚Ä¢ A deep understanding of technical SEO best practices and the ability to identify and recommend improvements to site performance, URL structure, on-page elements, sitemaps, indexation, etc.
‚Ä¢ Previous experience in cleaning link building strategies (in-house or via agency).
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills, a strong team player, and the ability to clearly convey the SEO roadmap and ongoing performance to all levels of management.
‚Ä¢ Desire and ability to operate in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple projects and changing priorities.
‚Ä¢ Strong technical SEO skills, with expertise in HTML, CSS, JS, structured data‚Ä¶ 
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of the tech-related algorithm changes.
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in web migrations.
‚Ä¢ Project management skills.
‚Ä¢ Excel/Sheets proficiency.
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Fluent English speaker.
What do we offer?
‚Ä¢ Working in one of the leading companies in the creative industry.
‚Ä¢ A creative, dynamic, exciting, collaborative, and multicultural team.
‚Ä¢ Fast-moving environment in which you can hone your skills, learn along with your colleagues, and grow professionally.

title: Junior Marketing Paid Specialist (Native Level of Italian)
description:

You will be part of the Marketing Team. Your main responsibility will be to contribute to the growth of Domestika through the advertising and digital marketing channels.

Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. What does a Junior Paid Marketing Analyst do at Domestika?

What do we offer?

title: Junior Marketing Paid Specialist (Native Level of French)
description:
At Domestika we are looking for a Junior Marketing Paid Specialist (Native Level of French) - Remote - Time Zone GMT y GMT+2
You will be part of the Marketing Team. Your main responsibility will be to contribute to the growth of Domestika through the advertising and digital marketing channels.
Domestika is one of the largest growing creative communities within the creative industry. It all started as a small but dynamic showcase of creative professionals, designed to help them connect and learn from each other.
Years later, born from this core value, Domestika widened its reach by designing and producing online courses for all those who want to learn and improve professionally with the best teachers. The community has grown to more than 5 million people who are constantly curious and passionate about learning new skills.
What does a Junior Paid Marketing Analyst do at Domestika?

title: Product Designer
description:
About us 
Launched in 2019, TaxDown wants to be the leading platform for consumers and companies to manage their taxes and finances.
TaxDown was born with the aim of creating a technological platform that allows taxpayers to process their taxes from any device, maximizing their savings and making the process as agile and simple as possible. In less than two years we already have more than 60k taxers who trust us, and we thank them for working continuously to keep helping them.
We help people save money 
TaxDown is the only solution in Spain that allows you to file your taxes digitally, in less than 15 minutes, with less than 9 questions, and with an average saving of ‚Ç¨385 per user.
We want to recover every euro that is yours by right. This year we have managed to save more than ‚Ç¨3.8M for Spanish families. During our first 2 income tax seasons, we have revolutionized the way people do their taxes because we want to help everyone to better understand their tax obligations and rights, not just those who can afford a tax advisor.
The challenge? What if we manage to continue helping people and saving them money? What if all those people who are scared to death due to ignorance, who due to lack of resources cannot pay an advisor, or who innocently believe that the Tax Agency does a rigorous job with the tax return draft (¬®Borrador¬®), could have an affordable, simple solution that solves an obvious problem such as personal income tax filing? Well, they will probably feel very grateful, and that is what we like the most, helping and being useful.
There are more than 24 million people who file tax returns in Spain, and we want TaxDown to be the alternative they choose when the tax season arrives.
What we are looking ü¶Ñ
We are looking for a good person, who can become a world-class PD, optimistic, passionate, creative, dynamic, and analytical. Someone to lead our product efforts and seize the opportunity to build magical experiences for our taxers, in a market yet to be exploited, helping us to define and to execute our strategy and vision. Attracted to start-ups, technology and wanting to change the status quo. Willing to accept responsibilities above the average, a high degree of autonomy. This is a highly visible and impactful role that will own the product strategy and roadmap to acquire the next 1 million taxers on TaxDown.
Through trial and error, we have learned that people do not apply unless we provide a guideline. But what is more important to us than a number are the experiences you have had, and the skills you‚Äôve developed, regardless of the length of time it took you to get where you are. Have 10+ years? Awesome, please apply. Have only 3 years, but feel you meet the requirements below? Great, please apply.
‚Ä¢ 3+ years‚Äô experience crafting powerful product design stories, e-2-e design solutions, and conducting research on desktop, mobile, and cloud-based projects
‚Ä¢ Success innovating user interfaces, web/mobiles apps, and distance learning
‚Ä¢ Ability to ask, as well as answer, meaningful and impactful questions
‚Ä¢ Ability to go beyond the data to develop core insights about user behavior and understanding
‚Ä¢ Skills to transform these insights into actionable product and design outcomes
‚Ä¢ Success innovating user interfaces, web/mobiles apps, and distance learning
‚Ä¢ Experience with web analytics and/or software instrumentation/ data visualization (i.e. hotjar)
‚Ä¢ Possess excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills
‚Ä¢ Appreciation and valuation for crafting incredible customer service products and services
‚Ä¢ Deep knowledge of UX/UI end-to-end design tools (pen&Paper, Sketch/Figma, AdobeXD, Invision, Photoshop, Illustrator, Marvel, Zepplin, etc.)
BonusüèÜ
‚Ä¢ Experience with customer behavior and gamification is a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with illustration or animation (or both)
‚Ä¢ Experience participating in or leading user research sessions
‚Ä¢ Understanding of developer communities within the software or product space
‚Ä¢ Formal Degree in Design, Interaction/UX Design, human-computer interaction, or others relevant
What would you put all your passion and effort into üíª
Help us improve our product
‚Ä¢ Lead a hypothesis-driven approach to determine the product-market fit of new and existing solutions, iterating constantly throughout the entire design and development cycle
‚Ä¢ Design cool UX/UI studies and reviews of TaxDown current design standards and methodologies
‚Ä¢ Take full ownership of the cross-platform user experience for projects from start to finish, including wireframes, mockups, and prototypes
‚Ä¢ Manage your own process: Identify and execute on high-impact projects, triage external requests, and bring projects to the conclusion in time for the results to be useful
‚Ä¢ Work together across all disciplines of design, product management, engineering, data science, leadership, marketing, and planning
‚Ä¢ Support on UX development across geographies and cultures
User is king! Continuously work on understanding our taxers' needs
‚Ä¢ Identify market opportunities through customer research and insights, and prioritize user needs to deliver on meeting user and company expectations
‚Ä¢ Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative and quantitative methods (polls, interviews, online testing, group testing, or whatever you think could help to understand the value for the user)
‚Ä¢ Lead participatory and design thinking workshops with stakeholders
Support on understanding our user needs
‚Ä¢ Own client iteration process and focus on creating systems and tools for high-quality, high-efficiency customer interactions
‚Ä¢ Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods (interviews, groups or whatever)
‚Ä¢ Lead participatory and design thinking workshops with stakeholders
What makes us different and what can we offer you
We are a young spirit, dynamic, enthusiastic, and happy team, and we want to stay that way! Here are some reasons why you will love being part of our TaxDown family:
‚Ä¢ Be part of a new project that will reshape the future of taxes and personal finances in the world
‚Ä¢ A young-spirit team in a dynamic work environment, focused on your growth
‚Ä¢ Use of state-of-the-art technologies
‚Ä¢ Premium and cool office location in the centre of Madrid
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and environment, remote-friendly
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and the possibility of participating in the success of the company
‚Ä¢ Workshops, Meet-ups & Hackathons
‚Ä¢ Futbol√≠n, games, fun events‚Ä¶ and free coffee & drinks. Beers sometimes too üçª
Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to our values. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives

title: Data Analytics Consultant
description:
What is Making Science?
Making Science is a leading digital marketing and technology consulting firm, that is listed in the Madrid Stock Exchange. We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, Par√≠s, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. We are a company that specializes in providing comprehensive marketing and technological solutions for digital businesses. Our team is composed of more than 300 digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data.
Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person‚Äôs contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?
Some details about your department
At GMP, we are a young, energetic, and fun team! We believe that shared knowledge, teamwork, and internal training are the basis of a versatile, integrated, and powerful team. We highly value a thirst for knowledge, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities, because they help us stay up to date in an industry as dynamic as digital marketing. We are committed to the promotion of team building events, both inside and outside of the company, that will help us get to know each other better. So, if you think you fit in, don't hesitate and apply to our offer!
Your role
- Follow-up on clients. 
- Create personalized dashboards and reports based on the client‚Äôs objectives.
- Analyze and optimize web pages in order to achieve set goals.
- Identify digital assets and web page structures that guarantee the best measurements. 
- Create tags for web, email, and marketing campaigns. 
- Revise the implementation code for good measurement (GTM, personalized variables and parameters, events, Enhanced Ecommerce...).
- Create Attribution Models, funnels, dashboards...
- Perform usability analysis on different devices (desktop, tablets, mobile).
- Create A/B and multivariate tests to improve a web‚Äôs conversion rate on different devices. 
- Perform Cross-device measurements. 
- Perform TV measurements.
What will you need to do this role?
- We are looking for someone who‚Äôs proactive and eager to learn, and has the capacity to adapt to new challenges with a positive attitude. 
- You have between 2 and 4 years of previous Data & CRO experience.
- You have an advanced level of English, both spoken and written. 
- You have knowledge of JavaScript and/or web layouts.
- High level of languages: French and English
Perks of joining Making Science
- We give you complete stability with an indefinite job contract.
- We offer a fixed salary according to your worth and experience.
- Feedback is part of our day to day lives. We recognize a job well done through a continuous feedback model.
- We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours and one day a week where you can work from home.
- You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, free language classes, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more.
- Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don‚Äôt have a dress code.
- Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you‚Äôll grow fond of!
